loans.name: Irinea

texts.en:
Irinea is a 34-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children ages 6 and 2 years old. She has been engaged in vending vegetables which she harvests from her field for more than four years now. The business provides her the income that she needs for their expenses.

Right now, she is in need of additional capital for her business, so Irinea is asking for a loan worth 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the plants. With this, she will be able to enhance the quality and quantity of her harvest thus increasing her sales and profit.

Irinea dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable to generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save for the schooling of her young children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plants

loans.name: Joseph R.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Makeni. Their school was founded in 1994 to educate the children of their community. The school is currently staffed with 10 able teachers and has an enrollment of 371 pupils. This is the first loan that this school has applied for from Kiva lenders. 

Martha is the group's leader and headmaster at the school. She is 53 years old and was born in Mabanta village, on the outskirts of Makeni city. She has been in the teaching profession for 36 years now. She is married and has three children who are in college. Martha has requested this loan to pay college fees for her children. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school employees within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to do with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay the loan out of their salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children.

loans.name: Arche Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wayali, membre du groupe de crédit arche, femme vivant seule, dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 51 ans. Elle est vendeuses des boissons (Primus, Fanta, Mutzig, etc.). Elle a commencé son business par la vente de cannes à sucre au long de la rue, plus tard elle évolua et changea l’activité. Elle détient une petite maisonnette dénommée place vadam, siège où elle reçoit ses clients qui viennent attiser leur soif. Alors qu’elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants et petits fils. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 7eme crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 casiers (de Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et ouvrir ses horizons en ouvrant un snack bar. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client, Wayali, is a member of the loan group Arche. She is a woman living by herself, energetic, ambitious, a self-made entrepreneur, and 51 years old. She sells beverages (Primus, Fanta, Mutzig, etc.). She started her business by selling sugar cane on the roadside. Later, she advanced her business and changed it. She has a tiny place named Place Vadam, a base where she welcomes her customers who come to quench their thirst.

When she was informed about micro-loans, which the microfinance institution Hekima awards, she obtained her first loan of $50 to bolster her business. The profits from her business go to savings, food, and helping to cover schooling costs for her children and grandchildren. However, she just obtained her seventh loan. Over this time, this client saw her business really prosper. So she decided to increase the loan amount for this new cycle. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with 30 cases of beverages (Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.). In addition, she would like to open a snack bar in order to see her children grow up and expand their horizons.

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor women excluded from traditional banks to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 30 cases of Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luchadoras De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú les presentamos a la Alcancía Comunal  “Luchadoras de Yanacoto” es un nuevo grupo que empieza a trabajar con el Programa-Prosperidad y  está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras con el único  propósito de seguir trabajando y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Este es el caso de nuestra socia Bacilia.  

Ella es la tesorera del grupo, es casada y tiene 05 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Bacilia se dedica a la venta de buzos escolares, lleva en este negocio  más 07 años, sus deseos de progresar fue  que la  motivo a emprender dicho negocio. Poco a poco ha logrado capturar a sus clientes. Se siente orgullosa con sus logros pues gracias a su trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Solicito el crédito para la compra de buzos escolares, ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. Bacilia se siente feliz y agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Bacilia está ubicada en la parte de adelante viste casaca roja y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. We introduce you to the “Luchadoras de Yanacoto” communal bank. It is a new group that is starting to work with Programa-Prosperidad and it is made up of 6 enterprising women whose only purpose is to keep working and thus offer a better quality of life to their families. this is the case of the member named Bacilia.  

She is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has 5 children, 1 of whom is still dependent. Bacilia sells school sweatshirts and she has had this business for 7 years. Her wish to get ahead was what motivated her to start this business. Little by little she has been able to gain customers. She feels proud of what she has achieved because thanks to her work she has been able to improve her home and help her husband with the household expenses. Her next goal is finishing construction on her home. She asked for the loan to buy school sweatshirts, since she has orders to fill. Bacilia is happy and grateful to the people who made this loan possible. Bacilia is in the front, wearing a red jacket and gray pants.

loans.use: to buy school sweatshirts

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is 50 years old and comes from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married with  four children. Her eldest is 24 and her youngest is 6 years old. She has a T-shirt printing business which she started 6 years ago. Her husband works with her in helping make their business a success. Calixta is asking for a loan to buy textile paints, T-shirts and printing materials. She will then use these materials to increase her production and to accept more orders from her customers.

In the future, Calixta would like to make her place more spacious and attractive for her customers. For now, her income will be for her family's daily consumption and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy textile paints, T-shirts and printing materials

loans.name: Talanehsu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Talanehsu” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Rugiatu is the leader of this group. Rugiatu is 36 years old, married with 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Rugiatu sells palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for 16 years now. With the help of this loan, Rugiatu will invest in her business by buying gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 32-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business, selling a confection called 'kalamay". Kalamay is a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice. It can also be flavored with margarine, peanut butter, or vanilla. This is the source of her income.

Jonalyn is in need of additional income for her business. She is requesting a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy more ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, flour, peanuts and others. With this she will be able to increase her products and her sales.

Jonalyn has hopes of expanding her business and making it more sustainable so that it will generate more income. Jonalyn wants to improve their way of living and experience fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business such has sugar, flour, peanuts and others

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Saoudatou est revendeuse d'objets en plastique et de chaussures. Elle habite avec son mari et ses 3 enfants à Lomé. Ses enfants âgés de 14 à 20 ans sont tous scolarisés. Le mari de Saoudatou est vendeur de ciment. Saoudatou vend ses produits sur la devanture de sa maison. Elle aimerait augmenter son stock pour développer son activité. C'est dans ce but qu'elle a effectué un prêt chez WAGES. Saoudatou compte épargner les profits qu'elle réalisera dans le but d'assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en: Saoudatou is a retailer of plasticware and shoes. She lives with her husband and her three children in Lomé. Her children are from 14 to 20 years old, all with education. Her husband is a cement vendor. Saoudatou sells her products in front of her house. She would like to increase her inventory to develop her business. With this goal, she took out a loan at WAGES. Saoudatou plans to save the profits she will make with the aim of ensuring that the vital needs of her family are met.

loans.use: to buy plasticware and shoes

loans.name: Beliving God Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the "Beliving God" group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of small-scale businesswomen has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to request a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses. In this way, sales and sales-to-profit-margin will improve for these borrowers. Consequently, they are being empowered to better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and schooling.

The leader of this group is Isatu, a 44-year-old native of Yonie village married to a trader and the mother of four children - two in primary school, one in secondary and one an adult. Isatu sells market food such as palm oil (the most country's popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been a businesswoman for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantites to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
After seeing a need for printing services in the Bastrop, Texas area, Marlene decided she would merge her wishes to create her own schedule and be her own boss with the demand for printing services when she opened Business and Personal Solutions in her hometown of Cedar Creek, Texas.

Business and Personal Solutions helps local businesses and organizations by offering customer service and low-cost printing of business cards, letter heads, programs, fliers and similar paper items. Within her business, Marlene offers replenishment and courier services with City of Austin and Capital Metro, Austin’s public transportation service, as she is contracted through these institutions. Her new business, created in 2003 and licensed in 2006, also allows Marlene to spend more time with her 4-year-old son. 

With a total of 13 employees, Marlene has six employees replenishing route information for Capital Metro and seven employees performing courier services for the City of Austin. Though she does not print the door hangers for the City of Austin or route information for Capital Metro, Marlene plans to in the near future when she can afford to upgrade her digital copier for a faster off-set printer, which is required for the bus schedules and door hangers. 

Until then, she plans to use the loan, obtained after approval from Accion Texas Inc., to have working capital, payroll, market her business, start a website, and purchase vests and caps as uniforms for her employees; these will include her business name and aid in marketing her business. Marlene also wants to purchase trinkets, such as pens, calendars or paper weights with her business name, and if she has enough funds left over, a website.

Without the loan, Marlene says she would have accomplished everything on her own, but would have less money to do so. She says, without the loan, “I would have to wait on the hats and vests and market door-to-door instead of using mail-outs.”

loans.use: to have working capital and pay for payroll, marketing, vests and caps as uniforms for her employees, and if possible a website.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Sra.  Nelva tiene 52 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una persona quien le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes cuando no tienen clases, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena,  y también para el arreglo del techo de su negocio, la Sra. Nelva es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Nelva, 52, offers a variety of prepared foods to her customers every day from a stand in her home. The business, which she has built with another person who cooks and serves customers when she isn't attending class, is her and her family's primary income source. The loan will be used to buy wholesale supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles, and others) so that her stockroom is full and to fix the roof of her business. Nelva, a hardworking person who has spent years selling prepared foods, is very grateful to the institution for the support it offers.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fix the roof of her business.

loans.name: Tonh

texts.en:
Tonh is a local farmer living in Kampot province, Cambodia. Farming is the family’s main source of income. He owns a few hectares of field, on which he primarily grows rice, both for sustenance and for sale. He has been in the business for almost 30 years ago, earning approximately of 5.00 USD per day. His wife is his good partner who always helps him in maintaining their farm. Tonh is now 42 years old and has eight children, some of whom are employed while the other are still students.

With the requested loan, Tonh plans to purchase a motorcycle for their transportation needs because his family is big, so they need more requirements for a better living situation. Tonh aims to provide a higher education to all his children through his hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.en:
Ngor is a responsible father who is involved in a farming business to support his family. He is 27 years of age and has two dependent children who are still enrolled in school. Nngor strives to work harder because he wants to save money for his children’s education. In the next few years, one of them will be ready for his secondary school and need more allowances. Despite his hardships and difficulties, Ngor has strong determination to improve their standard of living. 

Ngor needs to acquire additional capital to buy necessary farm supplies for his rice crops in order to have plentiful crops and yield a good income upon harvest. He will purchase fertilizers and pesticides. He believes that he can improve the business through the effect of this loan and he hopes that Kiva lenders will not reject his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun is a 31-year-old mother who is working very hard because she wishes to experience a better living standard. She manages a rice farming business in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. Her husband is also working in the same fields to provide basic needs for their children. Together, this couple has given birth to two children who are still at school. 

Roeun aims to help her children in their education until they finish their university degree, so she has to generate more income to save gradually from this present time onwards. As a result, she would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to add to her savings to establish a new business – she will purchase merchandise such as snack foods, sweets, shampoos, spices, canned items, noodles, beverages, and other miscellaneous household things to sell from her own house. Roeun hopes to yield a better income from this type of business, so that she can save more for her children’s future education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as snack foods, sweets, shampoos, spices, canned items, noodles, beverages, and other miscellaneous household things to sell from her own house.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es: Ana Dilia tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad con sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando y el otro le ayuda en la agricultura.   Junto a su hijo mayor cultivan la tierra, para poder sacar lo necesario para el sustento de la familia.  Además de la agricultura también posee una pequeña tiendita que le ayuda a inyectar un poco de efectivo a su economía.  Es una mujer emprendedora la cual hace todo por su familia ya que ella es el principal sostén del grupo familiar dado que su esposo falleció  hace algunos años.  Es muy conocida en la zona donde habita como una mujer trabajadora, ejemplar, carismática y sobre todo responsable que con mucho esfuerzo lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones por lo que se ha propuesto darles el estudio para que un día puedan ser unos profesionales con mejores condiciones de vida. Todo esto es lo que le da fuerza a seguir trabajando, ya que no pierde la fe de que  algún día logrará su sueño.  Solicita este préstamo a INTGRAL para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el buen desarrollo de los cultivos los cuales espera sean abundantes y de buena calidad, para poder continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar y seguir alimentando su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana Dilia, 40, lives in the house she owns with her three children two of which are in school and the other one helps her in agriculture.  Together with her oldest son she tills the soil to be able to grow what’s needed for her family’s sustenance.  

In addition to agriculture she also has a small store to inject a little cash into her economy.  She is an enterprising woman who does everything for her family since she’s the main source of support in her family group because her husband died some years ago.  

She’s very well-known in the zone where she lives as a hardworking, exemplary, charismatic and above all, responsible woman who strives with much effort to move her children forward.  Her dream is to see her children in better condition which is why she’s determined to provide them with schooling so that one day they can be professionals with better living conditions.  

All of this is what gives her the strength to continue working; she does not lose faith that someday she’ll reach her dream.  She’s asking INTEGRAL for this loan to buy farm supplies needed for the good development of her crops which she hopes will be abundant and good quality to continue bringing sustenance home and continue nourishing her dream.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Arturo

texts.es: Pedro Arturo de 45 años de edad, vive junto con su esposa e hijos en casa  de su propiedad. El se dedica a la venta y cultivo de plantas ornamentales.  Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el  área. Además ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes ya que lo prefieren por ser un hombre trabajador, carismático y responsable. Es importante agregar que  muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que los vende en buen estado y a muy buenos precios.  De los ingresos de su vivero es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos y él es el sostén económico de la familia. Para mantener sus plantas en buen estado necesita invertir en los abonos e insecticidas necesarios ya que son indispensables para su buen desarrollo y así poder seguir ofreciendo calidad en sus plantas. Esto es lo que lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para dicha inversión, espera obtener resultados favorables ya que no pierde la fe que con su trabajo y la ayuda de esta institución logrará su sueño de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Arturo, 45, lives with his wife and children in the house he owns.  He works growing and selling ornamental plants.  He has been working in this line of work for many years so has much experience in the area.  He’s also succeeded in winning over the trust of his customers who prefer him for being a hardworking, charismatic, responsible man.  It’s important to add that many people prefer his products because he sells them in good condition and at very good prices.  

With income from his nursery he’s able to provide sustenance for his home since he has no other source of income and he’s his family’s sole support.  In order to maintain his plants in good shape he needs to invest in the necessary manure and insecticide that are indispensable for their proper growth so that he can continue selling quality plants.  

This has led him to request this loan from INTEGRAL because he does not have the economic resources for said investment and to obtain favorable results since he does not lose faith that by means of his work and help from this institution he will reach his dream of improving sales and income and consequently his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Pablo Juan

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 51 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón para esforzarse y sacarlos adelante; él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a sus padres, Pablo no pudo terminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pablo trabaja en el rubro de la construcción como  maestro de obras, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana Pablo asiste a laborar, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labora ya que le va bien por su empeño y dedicación que pone en las construcciones que realiza.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso a su vivienda; de esta manera Pablo tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones y así podrá brindar mayor bienestar a su familia y así poco a poco espera poder terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pablo is 51 years old, he is happily married and he lives in the town of Nazca with his wife and their 2 children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for working hard to make them progress in life. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person. Unfortunately, he has not been able to complete his secondary studies as he had to help his parents, but he would have very much liked doing it. In his free time he likes relaxing by listening to a bit of music, and in some occasions he cooks a really delicious “Escabeche de pollo” (pickled chicken) to share it with his family.
Pablo works in constructions with great determination and dedication. He is a master builder, and he goes to work every day starting very early in the morning. He works 10 hours a day approximately, and he feels at ease with his job as things are going well thanks to the determination and dedication he works with.
Pablo feels deeply grateful to Kiva Lenders, as thanks to their help he will succeed in making improvements to his house. He wants to install a floor in his house in order to improve his living conditions and to offer a better standard of living to his family, little by little succeeding in finishing building the whole house.

loans.use: To buy materials to install a floor in his house.

loans.name: Jesus Yovanny

texts.es:
Jesús es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Nazca, a pesar de su corta edad el es muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, con un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Jesús se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Minas, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo día a día Jesús trabaja como chofer de taxi, desde tempranas horas de la mañana recorre las calles y avenidas de su ciudad para brindar sus servicios, él trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde puede encontrar pasajeros y también por su trato amble y respetuoso.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el cambio de aceite y el mantenimiento general de su auto; de esta manera Jesús tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones lo cual le permitirá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y así espera lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Jesús is 20 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents and his siblings in the town of Nazca. Despite his young age, he is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic man with a great desire to progress in life. Thanks to his parents’ support Jesús is now studying Mining Engineering. In his free time he likes relaxing while listening to music; in some occasions he cooks the delicious "lomo saltado" (Peruvian steak and potatoes) to share it with his family.
Out of his own initiative, and with great enthusiasm and determination, Jesús works every day as taxi driver, starting very early in the morning and driving along the streets and avenues of his town to offer his service. He works 8 hours a day approximately, and he thinks his job is going well because he knows the area where he can find passengers waiting and also because of his kind and respectful character.
Jesus feels deeply grateful to Kiva Lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy new oil for his car and to pay for the general maintenance of his vehicle. Thanks to this, his car will be in better conditions and he will be able to continue working and making efforts to progress in life, in order to succeed in becoming a great professional and thus making his biggest dream come true.

loans.use: To buy new oil for his car and to pay for the general maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do improvements on her home.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y a quienes ha sacado adelante con el apoyo de su esposo ya que ellos siempre les han inculcado que con trabajo y sacrificio todo se puede; la vivienda de Juana se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza porque se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, pallares, maíz, entre otros; asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo encontramos diversidad de comidas típicas, entre las cuales se encuentra el delicioso “Chupe de Camarones”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear junto a su familia para poder compartir. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres, Juana solo tuvo estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Juana trabaja en su negocio de venta de bollo, alfajores, gaseosas, alfajores, entre otros; ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puedo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con mucho gusto y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Juana es muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente realizar un cambio en las cañerías de agua de su vivienda ya que actualmente el agua se ha filtrado humedeciendo las paredes de su vivienda, asimismo realizara el pintado de la misma, con esta mejora ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo evitar que su vivienda se deteriore; así ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local para la venta de sus productos”.
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard-working woman.  She has three children who are now adults and who she has helped to get ahead with the support of her husband by teaching them that with work and sacrifice, anything is possible.  Juana's home is located in the city of Camaná, a city known for agriculture, especially growing rice, lima beans, corn, and other crops.  There is also fishing and, above all else, there is great diversity in typical cuisine such as the delicious "Chupe de Camarones" (Shrimp Chowder).  When she has free time she likes to go on walks with her family to spend time with them.  Because of her parents' lack of resources, Juana only studied in primary school - though she would have liked very much to study at the university.

Day by day, Juana works in her business selling bread rolls, cookies, sodas, and other items.  She works about eight hours per day as with the income from her work she can help her husband with the household expenses.  She thinks that her business is going well because she works with pleasure and above all else because of her desire to succeed.

Juana is very thankful to the people who loan to Kiva; thanks to their help she will be able to make improvements on her home, especially with the plumbing as the pipes have leaked into the walls of the house, making the walls damp.  She will also paint the walls and with these improvements will have a better quality of life and will avoid deterioration of the house.  In this way she will continue to work to realize her biggest dream, which she says is, "To have a shop to sell her products."

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Mala con su esposo y sus 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos se encuentran bajo su cuidado y los demás ya son adultos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que junto con su amado esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus nietos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.

Gracias al apoyo de su familia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 2 años Lucia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de frituras y desayunos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella se dirige a un mercadillo de su distrito para realizar sus ventas, ella dedica a su labor un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.

Lucia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual le servirá de mucho para transportar sus alimentos a su centro de trabajo y adicionalmente para hacer entregas a domicilio de algunos clientes que lo soliciten; des esta manera Lucia espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, así ella seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para poder brindarles una educación superior a sus 2 últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 42 year old woman who lives in the city of Cañete  in the district of Mala with her husband and her 6 children, of whom two are still in her care and the rest are already adults.

She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, with her beloved husband, dedicates all her efforts to moving her family ahead. In her spare time, she enjoys playing with her grandchildren and on some occasions she cooks a delicious “Lomo Saltado”, to share with her family. 

Thanks to her family’s support and with a great deal of dedication, she started a small business selling fried food and breakfasts two years ago. She works every day and goes to a market in the district very early in the morning to make her sales. She works approximately 10 hours a day and believes she is doing so well because of her foods’ good flavoring and because of her friendly service to her customers.

Lucia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to purchase a motor taxi, which will be a great help in transporting her food to her work site and also in making deliveries to the homes of some of her customers who request them.  In this way, Lucia hopes to be able to increase her sales and income. Thus, she will continue working hard to be able to provide a higher education to her two remaining minor children.

loans.use: to purchase a motor taxi.

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Chom is a 23-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district with her spouse and a small child. She is very ambitious for her farming business and aspires to elevate her living standards. She is a proud farmer who owns two hectares of land, on which she grows rice for her daily sustenance as well as for sale. She has been doing this business for nearly 10 years as she learned to do it from her parents. 

Chom now is requesting a loan of 500 USD to use in purchasing extra farmland to expand her business and thus increase her rice production each harvest season. Chom has a strong belief in developing her business and she hopes that she will be a successful young entrepreneur as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to use in purchasing extra farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 71 years of age, married, and has five children, three of whom are already settled in marriages and live separately from her. She has been spending her lifetime with agricultural businesses as the main source of her family’s income. Rice farming is the first priority, and followed by a fish raising business as the second one. Sun has been doing these businesses for ages, and they provide very good revenues. Next to her house, Sun dug a big pond for raising small fish which she buys from the market. Upon maturity, local traders will contact to her for the purchase of all her raised fish.

To maintain her business and make a consistent income, Sun is now asking for a loan in the sum of 1,200 USD to purchase feeds and more fish to raise. Money from the loan will allow her to manage a good growth of her business. She has improved her economic situation with help from the previous loan and this will be her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and more fish to raise.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean is 36 years old and blessed with three school-aged children who still need her daily allowances. Hean happily works on her two and half hectares of farmland, growing various kinds of seasonal crops including rice, beans, potatoes, and vegetables. Through her hard work, she is able to make around 26,000 KHR per day to support herself and her children’s education. She has been engaged in this for over 12 years. Her husband is the main supporter in the business.

To maintain a good growth of her crops, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 KHR in order to hire local laborers to transplant rice as well as to work her potato plantation. Hopefully, she can provide a better living for her family in years to come.

loans.use: to hire local laborers to transplant rice as well as to work her potato plantation.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina tiene 26 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos.
Desde muy niña ayudó a sus padres en los cuidados de sus cultivos, le gusta mucho verlos crecer y madurar. Desde hace poco empezó a encargarse de administrar esa actividad porque sus padres ya no tienen la misma fuerza de antes. “Me va muy bien, puedo tener un capital estable, trato de ajustar los gastos al mínimo”, afirma. Sus principales siembras  son: papa, olluco, pasto y heno. “Los terrenos son de mis padres, ahí siembro diversos productos, que comercializo a la ciudad de Lima, donde obtengo más ganancias”, comenta. Ahora piensa sembrar papa en gran cantidad, ya se encuentra trabajando duro para obtener buenos resultados, aún le falta un poco de fertilizantes. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Pueblo nuevo” y este es su séptimo crédito con MFP. Se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal, porque recibe consejos para mejorar sus plantaciones, pues todos son agricultores como ella. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todos son responsables.
Celina invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de dos sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Celina, 26, lives with her parents and siblings in her parents’ house.  Since she was a little girl she’s helped her parents care for the crops.  She likes to watch them grow and mature very much.  A short while ago she started to take over managing the work because her parents no longer have the strength they used to have.  

“I’m doing very well; I’m able to have stable capital and I try to keep costs down to the minimum,” she affirms.  Her main crops are potatoes, ‘olluco’ [an Andean tuber], grass and hay.  “The land belongs to my parents and I grow various products there that I sell in the city of Lima where I obtain higher profits,” she comments.  Now, she plans to plant potatoes in greater amounts and is working hard to obtain good results; she still needs some fertilizer.

She belongs to the “Pueblo Nuevo” (New Town) communal bank and this is her 7th MFP loan.  She feels at ease working in her communal bank because she gets good advice for improving her crops because all of them are farmers like her.  She also promises to be punctual with her installment payments because all of them are responsible.  Celina will use the money from this loan to buy two sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sobre todo laboriosa. Vive en su casa propia junto a su  esposo Chinee, de 46 años, y sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
Elizabeth tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda desde hace 5 años, donde a veces cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos o de su esposo. Sus clientes se sienten contentos de ser bien atendidos, además de encontrar todos los productos necesarios para preparar sus alimentos. Lo más dificultoso es cuando los estantes de su tiende quedan vacíos, sin poder contar con muchos productos, por ello hace uso de los préstamos para incrementar su mercadería.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de seguir contando con este apoyo financiero para mejorar su negocio. Asimismo, en su banco comunal se siente cómoda de formar parte de ellos, pues son personas que apoyan el progreso de los demás.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de: menestras, verduras, conservas, productos de limpieza, etc., de esa forma mejorará su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 46, is a very happy and very hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her 46-year-old husband Chinee and their two children, to whom they wish to offer a better life. Elizabeth has had a grocery store in her house for five years that her husband and children help her manage. Her customers like to be waited on and find all the items they need to prepare their meals. That is hard when her shelves are empty and she doesn't have much stock. Then Elizabeth uses loans to restock her merchandise. 

This is her third loan cycle with MFP, and she is happy to have this financial support to grow her business. She is also comfortable being part of her communal bank because the members support each other's progress. She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles to improve her store by stocking stews, vegetables, jams, cleaning products, etc.

loans.use: to improve her store by stocking stews, vegetables, jams, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong is an industrious woman who dreams of growing her business. She wants to uplift her family’s standard of living to attain a better quality of life. She is in the business of selling fish in a small market in the Reussey Keo district of Phnom Penh. She has been in this type of business since 2000, and she noticed that she made a good profit from it. Duong is a mother of four children. She is also 55 and a widow. Her son helps her earn income by working as a fruit vender.

With the income from her current business, Duong would like to invest in a hog-raising business in order to double her income in the next few months. However, due to the lack of funds, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase pigs and piglets to raise in her backyard wooden pigpen and to buy feed for them. This loan will make her plan possible, and she hopes that it will provide her with a greater profit in order to enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and piglets to raise in her backyard wooden pigpen and to buy feed for them

loans.name: Matayian

texts.en:
Matatian has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD,after servicing his previous loan successfully .
 [repaid it back].  

He will use the loan amount
 [to buy spare parts and repair his motorbike for better service to his customers.He uses the motorbike for transport.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to provide for his family and own a successful business.

loans.use: to  buy spare parts and repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Rither

texts.en:
Rither is married and aged 41 years old. She is blessed with five children aged 25, 23, 21, 20,19 years old. She operates a carpentry shop in Narok and has been running the business for six years earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.


She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more timber for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children further.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy timber for her carpentry business

loans.name: Vart

texts.en: Vart is 62 years old and sells fish in the local market of Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US $3 every day. Currently, she lives with her grandson. Vart is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her grandson to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her grandson to commute to work

loans.name: Letisia

texts.en:
Letisia is 30 years old business lady. She is married to Edwin who is a business man. They are blessed with two children aged seven and three years respectively. She has been selling new shoes for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Letisia will use the loan to buy more stock of new shoes for sale.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a motorbike and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of new shoes for sale.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene 61 años casada ya con hijos independientes,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su decima cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Filomena utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y de esta manera tener más clientes y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Filomena is 61 years old, is married and has independent children. She sells staples in her neighborhood store, which is located in the Pampahasi area. 

This loan is her 14th loan cycle with the institution. Filomena will use the loan to buy wholesale grocery goods such as rice and sugar. She is asking for a loan because of her need to stock her business. Filomena faces some challenges in her business like imbalances in the local economy. She will use the profits to keep buying varied merchandise. 

Her wish for her business is to have a bigger and better stocked store, and thus have more customers and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale grocery goods such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Oy

texts.en:
Oy, a 22-year-old father of a lovely young child, is a primary school teacher in a local school in Ang Snoul district of Kandal province. He teaches small children between the ages of 5 and 7. He has been in this occupation for two years. He is married and his wife is employed as garment worker in order to help earn an income for the family.  

Due to the far distance between his house and school, Oy has to pay for transportation costs daily to reach his workplace. This causes him to spend a lot of money. To solve this problem, he has requested a loan of 600 USD to purchase a used motorcycle for commuting. He hopes that he can increase his savings to improve his standard of living and to use for future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan’s priority in life is to provide a better quality of life for her children, even though she has to work tirelessly in the crops field. Chan is 55 years old, and a single parent of five children – two married children and three single children. Chan grows rice and vegetables for sale each season and also she devotes her spare time to the hog-raising business for additional income. She has been involved in these businesses for many years.

With her desire to improve her businesses and to pursue a higher standard of living, she would like a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to add to her capital to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crops and to purchase more piglets for raising. She is thankful for the given fund because it is very helpful and makes her businesses more productive. She hopes to earn a higher income and further support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crops and to purchase more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum is 57 years old and owns around two hectares of farmland for cultivating rice as the major source of his income. He has been operating this type of business for almost 20 years, and his wife is a good supporter through farming practices. Soum is responsible for four children, two of whom are already married while the other two are single and have their jobs to help the family financially. Soum is agreeable to doing hard work at the fields because it is a way to earn a moral income for a lowly-educated man like himself.

Soum would like to apply some farm supplies to ensure a plentiful harvest this coming season, so he is requesting a loan of 800,000 KHR to supplement his capital to buy fertilizers and pesticides for good growth of his rice crops. He hopes that through this loan and experience from daily work, he can yield a better harvest than in previous years.

loans.use: to supplement his capital to buy fertilizers and pesticides for a good growth of his rice crops.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mann is a 50-year-old woman and a widowed mother of two grown-up children. She is a proud farmer who aspires to earn more and more from her farming business and uplift the standard of her living conditions, so she works honestly in the rice fields. She has been doing this for 33 years, and with her expertise and farming practices, she typically generates an average of 5.00 USD per day through farming rice. 

Mann aims to invest her profit in buying sugarcane in bulk from a plantation for future sale, but she has insufficient funds. That is why she has applied for additional capital of 250 USD to make her purchase. She hopes for great changes in her living status and is hoping to send her two children to attend a college after high school level.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Maiy

texts.en: Maiy, 41, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo province. She works as a farmer, making approximately US $1.50 each day, and her husband works in construction. Her family is also supported by her husband’s US $2 income each day, along with the income of two children who work in garment factories. Maiy is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase fertilizer and raise pigs. She believes that these purchases will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and raise pigs

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey Province (Cambodia), Pum is 35 years old and a father of three kids who are dependent on him to support them as they are still in school. He overcomes the family's financial burden via working on rice farming and producing handmade flat bamboo baskets. Both businesses earn him about 23,000 KHR per day. For this cycle, Pum and his co-member are sixth time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He has paid back the past loans successfully and they have helped him to better support both his businesses.

In this group of two, both of them are seeking a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. Pum will use some of his loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer for his farmland and the remaining portion will be used to buy bamboo for basket production. He hopes to earn more income to make a better living for his family.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of fertilizer and bamboo for making baskets

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: Sokchea is a villager of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia. As the 37-year-old mother of four children who need her care as they are still in school, she has been engaged in rice cropping as the primary source of income. Additionally, she also uses her spare time to add more income through working for others for a fee and selling coconuts. From the current business, which she has been in for 5 years, she can earn about 25,000 KHR. Sokchea's group consists of two female members; she is an eight-loan-cycle client and her member is a third-loan-cycle client. The previous loans have improved her business progressively and enabled her to buy a motorbike to assist her coconut selling business. Now, she and her group member are seeking a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field and the remaining amount to pay for a harvesting fee. She hopes to gain more income so as to make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a harvesting fee for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Yuon's Group

texts.en:
Yuon is a resident from the Mongkol Borey district of the Banteay Meanchey Province. She is a 35-year-old mother of four dependent children who are still in school. To support their big family, she and her husband have been working a paddy rice field for several years; they also work for others during their spare time for addition income. 

Yuon earns a daily average of 28,000 KHR from these businesses. She is the group leader for this loan group, and this is their eighth loan cycle. She has managed to pay back previous loans completely, which has enabled her to buy one additional hectare of farmland for growing paddy rice. For this new loan, Yuon's requested loan amount is 1,200,000 KHR, while her member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Yuon will use her loan portion to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and to pay weeding fees for the rice. She expects to increase her crop yields in order to keep expanding her current business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and to pay rice weeding fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en: Hon, 58, is a villager originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children, one daughter and one son, who currently are living with her and helping with the family business. She earns her income from her one hectare of farmland, where she plants cassava. Hon has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her loan group consists of three members, and they are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each as the first-time loan clients. As the group leader, Hon will use her loan portion to pay weeding fees and buy insecticide for her cassava field. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay weeding fees and buy insecticide for her cassava field.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a buyer and seller of bananas and bottles. Having had enough experience in hard living, Nilda decided to start her own business four years ago. In that time, she has improved her family's living, and would like to improve it further by saving money for her children's schooling. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more bananas and bottles for her business. Nilda hopes for your kindness and help to approve her loan.

loans.use: purchase more bananas and bottles

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en: Sokheng is 28 years old, married, and lives in a rural area located in the Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a daily living, she has been planting cassava for several years. Sokheang's group consists of two members, and both of them are the first time borrower with Kiva's partner, Visonfund. Sokheang and her member are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sokheang will use her loan portion to pay the weeding fees for her cassava field. She hopes to grow her crop in time, so she can make more income to better off her living condition.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fee for her cassava field

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly, 64, is a citizen from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is also a mother of six children, three of whom are still dependent on her. To maintain her household and its daily expenses, she has been growing paddy rice on three hectares of farmland as the family's major income. On another three hectare area, she also grows cassava to add to her revenue. Ly has been in this business for eleven years, and has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. With success, she has managed her business properly and improved her lifestyle steadily with the help of the past loan, which she has completely repaid. Now, forming a loan group of three female members, she is the leader. She and two members are taking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to pay the weeding fees for her cassava field. She expects to receive double crop yields to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to pay the weeding fees for her cassava field.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn is a 40-year-old mother originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven kids, three of whom (two daughters and one son) still need her support as they are still in school. To overcome the family's hardship, she grows paddy and cassava. Having been in the business for several years, she is able to make about 40,000 KHR per day. Sorn joined her first loan with VisionFund in 2011, the same year as her member; her group consist of two female members and she is the leader. She has used her first loan successfully in upgrading her living conditions and has managed to pay back the entire loan. Now, the new requesting amount for her and her member is 1,200,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to pay for a weeding fee and a portion of it to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for a weeding fee and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 48 años, está casada con Vidal, con quien tiene siete hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos y su pequeña nieta. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 27 años.
Ella se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a su rancho donde cuida de sus vacas y con la leche que producen elabora quesos. Pero la actividad que realizó por más de 15 años es la agricultura, tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas donde siembra maíz, papa y alverja. “Siembro en cantidad, por ello necesito capital, ya que el dinero no se ve, por meses, hasta la cosecha, donde vendo mis productos”, comenta. Es así que cuida mucho de sus cultivos, pues depende mucho de ellos para obtener buenas ganancias. Su secreto es comercializar sus cosechas en la capital del país, donde ya tiene clientes fijos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Pueblo nuevo” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. Se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal, allí recibe consejos para mejorar sus plantaciones, pues todos son agricultores como ella. 
Esta vez, Claudia invertirá en la compra de 7 bolsas de semilla de alverja y 65 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus próximas siembras de papa y alverja.
texts.en:
Claudia, 48, is married to Vidal and they have seven children but only two of them and her little granddaughter live with them in her own house that they bought 27 years ago.

She works in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She heads out to her ranch every morning to care for her cows and to make cheese with the milk they produce.  But the activity she’s been in for more than 15 years is agriculture.  She has her own fields where she grows corn, potatoes and peas.  “I plant in quantity which is why I need capital because I won’t see any income for several months until harvest time which is when I expect to have good profits,” she comments.  This is why she cares for her crops very carefully because she depends on them very much to obtain good profits. Her secret is to sell her crops in the nation’s capital where she already has steady customers.

She belongs to the “Pueblo Nuevo” (New Town) communal bank and this is her 10th MFP loan.  She feels good working in her communal bank because she gets good advice there on how to improve her crops because they are all farmers like her.  On this occasion, Claudia will invest in the purchase of 7 sacks of pea seeds and 65 sacks of natural fertilizer for her next potato and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en:
Rudelania is the coordinator of her group, La Nueva Esperanza (The new hope) 4, which is composed of five micro-entrepreneurs and located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area surrounded by fields of sugarcane.

Rudelania has operated a business selling jewelry and accessories mainly for women. She runs a little 'fantasia' (a small store where she sells different products). She will use her loan to increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, jewel, etc.

Rudelania and her long-term partner live together with their three children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her home structure. She is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. Rudelania would like to save her profits to build her house.

loans.use: To buy women's accessories and jewelry

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Leap, aged 30 years old, is the mother of two daughters and two sons. The rest of her family is residing in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has struggled to support all of her kids who are still in schools via working for others for a fee; her husband also helps to generate more income as a fisherman. For the 10 years that she has engaged in this business, she has been able to earn approximately 13,000 KHR per day. Leap's group consists of two female members; she is the group leader as a second time borrower while her member is a fourth time borrower. With success, she has paid back the entire loan and it has helped her to better support her husband's business via purchasing a fishing outfit and keeping her children in school. Now she is seeking a new loan with her member with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fishing net for her husband's business. She hopes to generate more profit and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fishing net

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, aged 45, works hard to support her family. She has a piggery business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase vitamins, feed and 3 more pigs. She has been in this business for more than a year now. In the future, Norma would like to save for the future of her four children. She prays for the growing of her business through the loan in order to have a stable source of income. She could then also soon offer an improved standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed and 3 more pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco  hace 22 años que vive en una comunidad lejana del torno; en villa San Carlos a 28 km. De limoncito. Tiene su parcela, donde vive y trabaja agricultura. El es casado con la Sra. Isabel su esposa quien es  ama de casa. Con 8 hijos todos trabajan con su padre en agricultura, donde siembran: maíz, sandia, maní, yuca y también se dedican  a la ganadería todo lo que ellos ayudan a sembrar a su papa y todo lo que siembran lo sacan a vender al mercado el torno, el Sr. Francisco que trabajan con emprender porque es  la única institución que les ha brindado su ayuda,  el crédito que ha solicitado es para compra d esemillas para la siembra de  maíz y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra,  son una familia muy unida y trabajadora y se sienten agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Francisco has lived in the remote community of Villa San Carlos, 28km from Limoncito, for twenty-two years. He has a plot of land where he lives and works farming. He's married to Isabel and she is a housewife. His eight children all work with their father farming, planting corn, watermelon, peanuts, and yucca. They also make a living raising cattle. Everything they help their dad plant and everything they plant they take to sell at the market around the area. Francisco is working to undertake this because this is the only institution that has offered him its assistance. The loan that he has requested is for buying seeds for the corn sowing season and the expenses implied in preparing the soil. The family is very united and hardworking, and they feel grateful for the help the institution has given them.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the corn sowing season.

loans.name: Fulgencio Arnoldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Fulgencio, tiene 43 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Yoro, departamento de Yoro.
Su actividad económica es brindar servicio de soldadura, torno en general, fabricación de piezas para vehículos y maquinas industriales, este negocio lo tiene hace 20 años y es su fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 28,000 lempiras para comprar materiales como hierro, estaño, acero y otros. El comprara en cantidades mayores porque así se ahorra dinero. También le ayuda a cumplir con los pedidos y brindar un mejor servicio. Su meta es actualizar la maquinaria para realizar mejores trabajos y que su taller sea administrado por su familia.
texts.en: Fulgencio, 43, is married and has four children.  He lives in the city of Yoro, Yoro Department.  His economic activity is providing welding services, general lathe services and manufacturing spare parts for automobiles and industrial machinery.  He’s had this business for 20 years and it’s his source of income to support his family.  He’s asking for a 28,000 lempira loan to buy materials like iron, tin, steel and others.  He’ll buy them in large amounts because he saves money that way.  It will also help him fill orders and provide better service.  His goal is to update his machinery to do better work and that his shop is managed by his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos. La casa donde viven ahora la heredó de sus padres hace 30 años.
Hace 2 años comenzó en el negocio de la compra y venta de fruta, él mismo trasporta las grandes cargas de fruta de los distribuidores a juguerias y fuentes de soda en la ciudad capital. Confiesa que con en la papaya obtiene más ganancias, ya que es la fruta que más se consume. Su negocio le es rentable, pues no tiene mucha competencia y ahora comenzará la temporada de cítricos por lo que quiere estar en condiciones para satisfacer la demanda.  

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Estrellitas” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo obtuvo beneficios en su negocio con estos préstamos, pues aprendió a invertir y obtener ganancias gracias a su grupo, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Edwin invertirá este dinero en la compra de millares de kilos de frutas de temporada (cítricos) para repartir en la capital.
texts.en:
Edwin is 42 years old, is married, and has two children.  He inherited his house from his parents 30 years ago.  Two years ago he started a business buying and selling fruit.  He transports the fruit himself, delivering large quantities from the distributors to factories that make juices and sodas in the capital city.

He reports that he makes the most income from papayas, since this is the fruit that is consumed the most.  His business is profitable, since he does not have a lot of competition.  Citrus fruits are now coming into season, so he wants to be in a position to meet his customers' needs.

He belongs to the supportive group“Estrellitas”, and this is his fourth loan with MFP.  In all this time his business has benefited from these loans.   He has learned to invest and make profits thanks to his group.  He promises to be punctual in repaying his loan.

Edwin will use the loan proceeds to buy thousands of kilograms of seasonal citrus fruits to distribute in the capital.

loans.use: to buy thousands of kilograms of seasonal citrus fruits to distribute in the capital.

loans.name: Ana Claribel

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio, pues ella depende económicamente de esta actividad, por eso cree necesario la inversión para comprarse nuevos estilos en blusas, ropa interior, faldas, ya que le permitirá ofrecer a los clientes una mayor variedad.

Con el préstamo anterior considera haber tenido una buena experiencia, ya que también logró realizar una buena inversión en prendas con nuevos estilos, su situación económica considera que está cambiando ya que actualmente vive en una condición más favorable.
texts.en:
Ana decided to request a new loan to invest in her business, because she is economically dependent on this activity. She thinks the investment is necessary to buy blouses, underwear and skirts in new styles. This will allow her to offer more variety to her customers. 

She had a good experience with the previous loan, because she managed to make a good investment in clothes with new styles. She believes her economic situation is changing and she now lives in a more favorable situation.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear and skirts.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre trabajador, es padre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y apoya con lo que puede ya que hace algunos años quedo viudo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la ciudad de Pucallpa se encuentra en la selva peruana, esta ciudad alberga flora y fauna muy bella, es un lugar donde uno puede apreciar lo hermoso de la naturaleza y sobre todo relajarse. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la Sarapatera, el cual es un plato típico de la zona. El solo puedo estudiar hasta el segundo grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica Automotriz.

Con mucho entusiasmo Jaime trabaja en su negocio de venta de raspadillas y refrescos, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes, también trabaja como chofer de mototaxi sobre todo cuando hay clientes que no tienen como movilizarse;  él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Jaime está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le dan su gran apoyo, y ahora podrá comprar una maquina raspadillera, con lo cual dará una mejor atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos  así el podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener para la venta de pescado y sal”.
texts.en:
Jaime’s a hardworking man and father of two children who he loves very much and supports any way he can since he was widowed several years ago. 
His home is located in the city of Pucallpa.  The city of Pucallpa is located in the Peruvian jungle and it houses very beautiful flora and fauna.  It is a place where one can admire nature and above all relax.  When he has free time available he likes eating one of his favorite dishes which is “Sarapatera,” [turtle soup] a dish that’s typical of the region.  He was only able to study up to second grade but would have like to have studied auto mechanics.

With much effort Jaime works in his business selling shaved ice and soft-drinks.  He works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 30 customers.  He also works as a mototaxi driver above all when there are customers who don’t have a way of getting around.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very kind to customers.

Jaime is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they give him their support and now he’ll be able to buy a shaved ice making machine that will let him provide better customer service and improve his income to continue working toward his greatest dream: to earn enough to sell fish and salt.

loans.use: to buy a shaved ice making machine.

loans.name: Jose Bitelio

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en su negocio, comprándose cerdos pequeños, para poder mantenerlos en la granja y engordarlos para el comercio, esta compra le ayudará para ganar un margen de ingresos por la venta a futuro.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, pues le permitió tener buenos ingresos, que hasta el momento le han servido para mantener una condición económica más estable con su familia y al mismo tiempo cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en: José’s asking for a new loan to invest in his business.  He will buy piglets to raise in his farm and fatten up to sell.  This purchase will help him obtain a margin of income from the subsequent sale.  His previous loan had a positive effect in that it made it possible for him to earn good income which to date has maintained his family’s economic condition stable while also covering household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 50 rolls of lace material @ Le 100,000.

loans.name: Tuzamurane / Rng 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ancile fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane / Rng 2. Le nom du groupe signifie «se soutenir l’un à l’autre». Il a 34 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 8 ans à 17 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Ancile est agriculteur de manioc. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de manioc, il planifie de louer d’autres champs pour augmenter l’agriculture de manioc. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le grand distributeur des maniocs dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et construire une belle maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Ancile is part of the group Tuzamurane / Rng 2. The group's name means "Support One Another". He is 34 years old and married, and he has five children, from 8 to 17 years old. He has a 5th grade education. 

Ancile is a cassava farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay for labor. 

To expand his cassava farming, he plans to lease other fields to increase his farming. In the next few years, he would like to be the region's big distributor of cassava. With the profits, he plans on covering the cost of his children's schooling and building a nice house for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
Soila, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar trabajando y mejorando el negocio y la atención a su clientela, invertirá con este nuevo financiamiento en la compra de productos para el negocio como frijoles, azúcar, gaseosas, plátanos, tomates, repollo, boquitas, pan, cebollas y aceite, éstos son algunos de los materiales y productos que comprara con este dinero por considerar que son necesarios para las ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener una buena inversión en el negocio y aumentar la disponibilidad de productos, hasta el momento ha logrado que su negocio sea estable y que sus clientes mantengan su preferencia, hasta el momento no han cambiado sus situaciones en la familia sigue estable.
texts.en:
Zoila has decided on a new loan to continue working and improving the business and customer care.  She will invest this new loan in the purchase of products for the store like beans, sugar, soft-drinks, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage, snacks, bread, onions and oil.  These are some of the materials and products she will buy with this money because she considers them necessary for the sales.

She got good results from the previous business loan in that availability of products increased.  To date she’s managed to keep the business stable and retain her customers’ preference.  Her family situation is also stable; there have been no changes to date.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mercedes, se ha decidido por un préstamo por la necesidad de continuar invirtiendo más en el comercio de ropa, invertirá los fondos prestados en la compra de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, ropa para niños, blusas y faldas para adultos, entre otra mercadería que es necesaria y que también considera que le traerá ganancias.

Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado permanecer en el negocio, manteniéndonos un surtido en prendas de vestir, sus ingresos han estado aumentando, para las diferentes circunstancias en la familia pues manifiesta haber tenido una mejor solvencia para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mercedes has decided on a new loan because she needs to continue investing more in her clothing business.  She will invest the loan money in the purchase of underwear for women and men, children’s clothes and  blouses and skirts for adults, among other merchandise that’s necessary and that she considers will produce profits.

With her previous loan she managed to stay in business keeping it stocked with clothes.  Her income has been increasing for the various family circumstances and she states that she’s been better able financially to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ten's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ten is a 28-year-old father of one dependent son. He and his wife make a living via rice farming on one hectare of farmland and cassava planting on two hectares of land. For 10 years involved in this business, he can earn about 29,000 KHR on average per day. For him, the declining price of cassava is the main challenge. 

Ten took his first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and completely paid it back. The past loan has made a good progress of his living conditions and maintained his business progressively. Now, he joins a group of two members to seek a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He will use his portion in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR, which is the same amount as his co-member, to pay for weeding for his cassava field. He expects to gain more crop yield so as to better his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en: Jeanylyn, aged 36, is operating a business buying and selling, particularly bananas. Her problem is that she hasn’t enough funds to maximize her business. For this reason she is seeking a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy bananas as well as vegetables so she can meet her customers’ orders.
