Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible que lo obtenga. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cronogramas de pago. 
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará madera para continuar con su labor de carpintero.
texts.en:
José Luis is 27 years old and lives in a house that he bought with his partner, 31-year-old Delia, and their three children.  He is a carpenter, and [has] made furniture for the past three years in a space that he converted in his home.  Additionally, he has a plot of land where he grows coffee and cocoa.    

Normally, in his carpentry shop, he relies on the support of a colleague, who helps varnish or put the finishing touches on the wood.  He commented that his main customers are his neighbors, but they also bring their furniture to other communities to sell.  José enjoys his work because it generates a good income [that allows him] to continue improving, and above all, [contributes] to the well-being of his family.  His greatest wish is that the furniture he produces, and brings to the surrounding areas to sell, becomes more well-known to the point that he has to enlarge his carpentry shop.

This is his first loan with MFP and he thanks all the people who make it possible for him to obtain [such a loan].  He also [accepts] the commitment to make his loan payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will purchase wood to continue his work as a carpenter.

loans.use: to buy wood to continue with his work as a carpenter.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en: Bernadita, age 40, has been engaged in rice farming for 10 years now. She is married and the mother of three children ages 10, 14, and 15. Farming has been her family’s source of livelihood. Like most mothers, she wanted her children to have a life quite different from hers. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and for her children’s education. In the future, she would like to till more land to be more productive with her crops and to make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Arche De Noe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bernadette est conseillère du groupe de crédit , elle est aussi enseignante dans une école conventionnée catholique, femme dynamique, très ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 34 ans. Elle est vendeuse des unités cellulaires. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette affaire, ce dernier ayant perdu dernièrement son emploi. La cliente a commencé son business par son maigre salaire d’enseignant. Plus tard elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l'IMF Hekima, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 12 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Malgré les défis, le maigre capital ; la cliente  prospère progressivement. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 250 cartes d’unités cellulaires (Vodacom, MTN, Air tel, CCT). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent  leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Bernadette, is the advisor of the loan group. She is also a teacher in a government-regulated Catholic school. An energetic woman, very ambitious, a self-made entrepreneur, and 34 years old, she sells cell phone minutes. She and her husband assist each other in this business, since he lost his job recently. Bernadette started her business with her meager teacher's salary. 

Later on, she was informed of micro-loans, which the microfinance institution Hekima grants. She benefited from her first loan for bolstering her business. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and covering her children's schooling costs. However, she just completed twelve cycles in the Hekima program. Despite the challenges and meager capital, this client is prospering progressively.

So this new loan must serve to supply her with 250 phone minutes cards (Vodacom, MTN, Air tel, CCT). In addition, she wishes to see  her children grow up and to buy a plot of land.

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor women excluded from traditional banks to become autonomous. It is appropriate to note that some clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy 250 cell phone minutes cards (Vodacom, MTN, Air tel, CCT)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en: Shorouq is a 20-year-old student living with her parents and 6 siblings in Irbid. She is a Business Administration major. She would like to get this loan so she can pay for her semester, and hopes to finish her schooling so she can help her parents with the expenses later on.

loans.use: pay her college tuition

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Irbid. She runs a small business at home that includes sewing and embroidery. She tries to help her husband with the expenses.  Iman wishes to get a loan so she can buy a small shop to run her business in, and buy a new sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: buy new sewing machine and a shop

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is a university student from Mafraq. His major is finance and he is in his second year. Talal pays for his own expenses and schooling. He wants to get a loan so he can pay for his semester and continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a conservative person, so she asked her oldest daughter to appear in the photo instead.

Sarah is a 40-year-old mother of 6. She lives with her husband and children in Madaba. She runs a mini-market selling basic materials and food from her house.  Sarah wishes to get a loan so she can buy more products to sell and serve more people in her area and neighborhood.

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Rasmiyeh

texts.en:
Rasmiyeh is a conservative person, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Rasmiyeh is a 38-year-old woman living with her husband and kids in Madaba. She has her own little shop for selling cosmetic products and make-up.  The shop is in an extension of her home.  Rasmiyeh would like to take a loan so she can fill her shop with new products and be able to sell to more people in her neighborhood and her area.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Using the previous loan, Mahmoud turned his shop into a mini-market and kept the sweets making section there as an added value to the store.  He has applied for this loan to buy a new machine to make more types of sweets.

loans.use: buy a machine to make sweets

loans.name: Samsir

texts.en:
Samsir is a 45-year-old married man with three children. He has bred cattle and cows for the last 10 years. During these years, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business. 

Samsir usually buys small calves, raise and fatten them for 5-6 months and then resell them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  Samsir also makes home yoghurt and sells it together with fresh milk to his neighbors.

Now Samsir would like to buy more animals and for this purpose he has applied for 1500 AZN.  He will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be his third loan with AqroInvest and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: buy 3 calves and a milk cow

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en:
Gulaya is a 43-year-old woman.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a widow and lives with her three children in an IDP settlement. 

Gulaya is dedicated to poultry breeding. She has already 12 years of experience in this field, which makes her skilled in this business.  She usually sells the chickens to market vendors from her yard. Her monthly income is 140 AZN and her son helps her to look after the poultry. This business takes a lot of physical activity and Gulaya spends most of her time outside under the sun. She is very hardworking and loves her poultry. She feeds them only organic food, that’s why it is so popular among local people. Chicken is very popular in Azerbaijan and many national dishes such as jigirtma and pilav are made of chicken meat. 

Gulaya would like to increase her monthly chicken turnover, and for this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN. This will be her second loan with AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: Artemio is 47 years old and has owned a sari-sari store for nine years now. He sells basic household items like rice, snack food, sugar, toiletries, canned goods and seasoning. He live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, with his wife and two children, ages 5 and 10. So far, his business is doing well but Artemio hopes to renovate his house as well as his store to make it more attractive to his customers. He is asking for a loan to buy cement, wood and steel for house and store renovation. He hopes that this will pave the way to a better income that will pay for his family's food consumption and school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy construction materials to improve his store and house

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan is a 33-year-old married woman with two sons. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her husband and children in an IDP settlement. She has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. Her husband also helps to run the business.  He fertilizes the land and gathers the crops.  Natavan's monthly income is 130 AZN.

Natavan grows apples, pears, peaches, plums and pomegranates and also vegetables. Fresh vegetables are very popular and people consider them healthy.  Many national dishes made of vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are serve at every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch. 

Natavan applied for 700 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizers for her land to increase the crops she produces.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wendmalgkondo Group

texts.fr:
Mme JOSEPHINE  est la représentante du groupe WENDMALGKONDO. Joséphine  se porte bien. Elle est mariée  et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 19ans. 04  vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du jus depuis  05ans. Elle est très contente d’avoir  le prêt car elle améliore son pouvoir économique. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques, les marchés .Ses clients sont  les amis ; voisins et autres  citadins.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de sucre, 01 sac de lait et 02 sacs de mil pour la fabrication du jus et des sachets pour le conditionnement.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut subvenir aux besoins familials.  Joséphine dit merci à Micro Start et ses Partenaires. Elle ambitionne  agrandir son activité ; ouvrir une alimentation de vente de jus et de dèguè.
texts.en:
Ms. JOSEPHINE is the representative of the group WENDMALGKONDO. Joséphine is doing well. She is married and the mother of seven women. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 19. Four of the children go to school. She has eight persons to support. 

She has been selling beverages for five years. She is very happy to have the loan because she is improving her economic capacity. She gets her supplies from shops and markets. Her customers are friends, neighbors, and other town inhabitants.

She wants to buy a sack of sugar, a sack of milk, and 2 sacks of millet for making drinks, and some pouches for packaging.  

With the profits, she wants to meet the needs of her family. Joséphine says 'thank you' to Micro Start and its Partners. Her ambition is to expand her business and open a grocery store selling drinks and dèguè (made with yoghurt and grains).

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, a sack of milk, and 2 sacks of millet for making drinks and some pouches for packaging

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en:
Sugra is a 49-year-old married woman with two children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 24 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Sugra usually sells her crop to the market vendors from her place. People consider fresh vegetables healthy and use them everyday in many national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at table in every Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch.  

Sugra's monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for a woman.  That is why her son and husband help also help her. 

Sugra needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover.  For this purpose, she has applied for 1600 AZN. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 38-year-old married woman who is very hardworking and experienced. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her husband and two sons in an IDP settlement. He husband is a workman and does not have a permanent place of work. Rahila breeds sheep for meat purposes and sells it to local butchers.  She has 10 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced farmer.

Rahila usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in 3-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar or from her yard.  Meat selling brings her 100 AZN in income per month. Mutton is a very popular product in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma.   

Rahila applied for 1500 AZN to purchase fodder and lambs. This will be her second loan and she has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: buy lambs and fodder

loans.name: Mawulawe Hortense

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Mawulawe Hortense vit avec son mari et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dans une école de la place. Elle vend des pagnes, de la friperie et des chaussures dans une boutique sise au cœur de la ville depuis sept ans. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. En vue de d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait agrandir son activité afin de détenir la grande part du marché et aider son mari à s'abonner à la source d'eau potable du Bénin.
texts.en:
Mawulawe Hortense, aged 33, lives with her husband and is the mother of three children, who are in a local school. For seven years, she has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), secondhand clothing, and shoes in a store located in the heart of the city. She stocks up from one of the markets in her sub-region. 

With the aim of growing her supplying capacity and satisfying customer demands, she requested and obtained financial aid from Finadev. This aid will enable her to bolster her business fund and to help with her children's schooling costs. She would like to expand her business in order to capture most of the market and to help out her husband to subscribe to Benin's potable water supply.

loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth, 2 dozen pieces of secondhand clothing, and 6 pairs of shoes of various types

loans.name: Qanira

texts.en:
Qanira  is a 49-year-old married woman. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her husband and five children. She raises fruits and vegetables in her garden. She started this business 10 years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people like to eat them fresh and make fresh juices, which is very healthy. 

Her husband is on pension and helps Qanira to sell the crops in the central bazaar.  Her monthly income is 120 AZN. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for a woman.  That  is why her husband also helps. 

Qanira needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover.  For this purpose, she applied for 1200 AZN.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 27 years old and is currently engaged in fishing. He is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has two children, ages 1 and 2. 

Renato would like to sustain his fishing business and is currently in need of financial help to repair his fishing boat. He will use the loan to pay for maintenance like repair of the wooden parts and paint.
 
It is his  dream that he can continue his business and even improve it for a bigger income.  His profit will provide a nutritious diet for his family, save for his children's future, and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 32-year-old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has a baby girl who is only one year old.  She operates a small business selling fried chicken called "chicken joy". Her business has been in existence for two years now. Her husband helps as a cook and they both work hard for their family. 

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like chicken meat, cooking oil, breading and pepper. This would help so she can continue her business and even increase her productivity. Elvira would like to add more to her menu in the future to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda has been in the business of fishing for 15 years now. She is married and has five children. Her eldest is 27 and the youngest is 15 years old.  She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, with her family.  

Leonarda needs to make improvements in her fishing, however she lacks the funds to do so. As of this time, Leonarda is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, fish hooks and gasoline for her boat. With the loan, Leonarda will be able to make her planned improvements possible, giving her family a chance to catch more and bring a good profit out of fishing. She hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: buy fishing net, fish hooks and gasoline

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 26-year-old single young man. He is a construction worker who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all his needs.  Qusai is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of completing his house in order to improve his living conditions, such as painting and installing tiles. Taking this loan will offer to Qusai suitable conditions so he can enjoy living in his house.

Qusai is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: finish building his house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who is pictured in his store, is a 27-year-old young man.  He is married and is a father to two daughters.

For the past seven years, Mohammad has had a store selling different types of cosmetics and women accessories.  It has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for his family, but it is not enough to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new collection of cosmetics and women accessories. This will offer to Mohammad's customers a wide variety of cosmetics and accessories to choose and buy, which will increase his sales and improve his family's income so they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice a 31 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. Béatrice a une baraque où elle vend des sacs de riz, des boîtes de conserve et d'autres produits alimentaires depuis six ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Béatrice a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'acheter des médicaments pour sa mère qui est malade.
texts.en:
Béatrice, aged 31, is married and the mother of four children. The oldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest is 8. Béatrice has a stall where she has been selling sacks of rice, canned foods, and other grocery items for six years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin.

With the aim of bolstering her sales and responding favorably to customer demands, Béatrice requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and to buy some medicine for her mother, who is ill.

loans.use: to buy 3 containers of peanut oil at 25 liters each, 4 sacks of rice, a basket of tomatoes, and a box of milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchadise to resell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 28 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.  Ricky provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Ricky has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gas

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Gina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  

Gina  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Cheryl  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3  years. Cheryl requested a loan for  PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.  

Cheryl  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Marylou has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6  years. Marylou requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Marylou  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Michelle has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell. 

Michelle  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 25 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.  Arnel provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Arnel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 58 años, desde que falleció su esposa ha quedado al cuidado de sus tres hijos. Ellos viven en la casa que compró gracias a los años de arduo trabajo.  
Lucio es un hombre trabajador que se dedica especialmente a la agricultura, tiene cuatro hectáreas con cultivos de cacao. Anteriormente su trabajo lo realizaba con el apoyo de su esposa, pero ahora lo hace con sus hijos y en las temporadas de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. Normalmente cuando labora en su parcela se dedica a mantener limpias y saludables sus plantas de cacao, para que de esa manera logre obtener un buen resultado en sus cosechas, las cuales comercializa en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, quienes gratifican a buenos precios según la calidad de su producto. 

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y agradece a las personas quienes una vez más hacen posible su crédito, el cual facilitará a sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, comenta que le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque los socios son personas.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono orgánico para sus cultivos de cacao.
texts.en:
Lucio is 58 years old.  Since his wife died, he has cared for his three children.  They live in the home he purchased thanks to years of hard work.

Lucio is a hardworking man who works as a farmer.  He has four hectares of cacao crops.  He used to do this work with his wife, but now his children help and he hires laborers during the harvest.  Normally when he works on his land, he keeps his cacao plants clean and healthy so that he can have a good harvest.  He sells the plants in the collection centers in his community, which give good prices according to the quality of your products.  

This is his 14th loan with MFP and he is thankful to the people who once again made his loan, which will facilitate his work plans, possible.  He says that he likes his community bank because the members are hardworking people.  

He will use this loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer for his cacao crop.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his cacao crop.

loans.name: Georgie

texts.en:
Georgie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Georgie  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6  years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell. 

Georgie  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Phonn

texts.en:
Phonn, aged 32, has been engaged in farming for over six years in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is pursuing to yield a better income from this business so as to provide her two children with a good education and satisfy their living needs. Phonn plants and harvests rice, potatoes, beans, and corn on her inherited farmland and sells to local traders for profit each harvest season. 

Due to insufficient funds, Phonn is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers for her cornfield. This loan will enable her to increase the volume of her productivity. She hopes to produce better yields than the previous year and she promises that she will pay back her loan as scheduled. This will be her second loan from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Patmos Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katungu est présidente du groupe Patmos, entrepreneur, couturière et sociétaire d’un atelier de coupe et couture. Elle est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son mari est un enseignant dans une école primaire. Cette cliente vend également les matériels de couture. Cette cliente fut formée dans un centre de formation de métier vers les années 2000. Elle se constituait à la longueur des années, un capital important grâce aux recettes de son job. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  tissus, papier, popeline, tirette, mordoré, etc.  Elle ambitionne améliorer son atelier et construire confortablement. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs. il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Katungu, is the president of the group Patmos. She is an entrepreneur, seamstress, and associate of a fashion house. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband is a teacher in a primary school. This client also sells sewing supplies. Around 2000, she was taught at a training center for the trades. She built up significant capital over the course of years, thanks to the income from her job. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with cloth, paper, poplin, loops, modoré, etc  Her ambition is to improve her workshop and to build with ease. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small-scale entrepreneurs. 

It is appropriate to note that some clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, paper, poplin, loops, mordoré, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 30 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.  Roberto provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 7 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 34 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines. Micheal is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for a year and every month he earns PHP 3,500 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to repair his existing vehicle for better service. 

Micheal is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to improve his general living conditions.

loans.use: repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Romilaine

texts.en:
Romilaine is 34 years old. She is married and has one child. She is engaged in a farming activity to earn a living. Romilaine has managed her farm for 7 years and earns PHP 20,000 a month.  In 2011, she joined GDMPC. 

Romilaine has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 from the cooperative to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop.  For this period of production, Romilaine hopes to reap more so she can have more farm to cultivate and to sustain her livelihood as well.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Elineta

texts.en:
Elineta is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 2 children. Elineta  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7  years. She requested a loan for PHP  7,000  to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Elineta  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, aged 42, is a humble farmer living in Baray district with her spouse, a teenaged child, and a mother. She has been raising crops for sale, including rice, potatoes, beans, and vegetables. Lim’s profit is just enough to provide the family their sustenance and allowances for her child who is still attending school.  Lim’s husband also provides the family with income from his transportation business. 

Because of mechanical problems with his motorcycle, Lim’s spouse has encountered difficulties offering his service. To solve this matter, Lim is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a new motorcycle, which will be used to provide good transportation services to the customers. Through this loan, Lim hopes that she will be able to give her family financial stability and better her living status.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Marlyn is single and has one child. To make a living, Marlyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns PHP 34,200 a month for these activities.   In 2008, Marlyn joined GDMPC.  

Marlyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Clémentine Christine

texts.fr: Agée de 61 ans, Clémentine Christine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. Elle a un restaurant sis au cœur de la ville où elle prépare et vend de différents mets et des boissons depuis plusieurs années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des béninois et des nigérians. Soucieuse de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle envisage réfectionner son bar restaurant et participer à l'éducation de ses petits fils.
texts.en:
Clémentine Christine, aged 61, is married and the mother of four children who are already supporting themselves. She has a restaurant located in the heart of the city where she makes different foods and drinks and has been selling them for several years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. Her customer base is composed of Beninese and Nigerians.

Concerned about bolstering her purchasing power and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This financial support will enable her to grow her extra revenues and to support herself. She envisions renovating her bar-restaurant and helping with her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of wine, 3 sacks of rice, 2 boxes of couscous, 2 boxes of canned foods, a box of macaroni, a box of liquor, and 6 cases of drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, separated, and has one child. To make a living, Alicia runs a general store. Alicia been in her business for 4 years and earns PHP 24,400 a month from these activities. 

Alicia is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, necesita invertir más en el negocio de la agricultura, esta decisión la ha tomado pues realizará una nueva siembra y para esto necesita comprarse los insumos como el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios para poder prevenir al cultivo de las plagas y la maleza, su objetivo es con estos préstamos mejorar la producción de granos básicos.

A través del préstamo financiado por kiva ha logrado mejorar su trabajo en el campo, asi mismo a su familia ha podido ofrecer una mejor condición para ir superando su situación económica.
texts.en:
Juan must invest more in his agriculture business.  He has taken this decision and will plant a new crop.  Accordingly, he will need to purchase materials like fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide which are necessary to prevent plagues and maladies from spreading through his crop.  His objective with these loans is to increase production of basic grains.  

Through this loan, financed by Kiva, he has been able to improve his field work as well as being able to offer his family a successful economic condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Gleceria would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gleceria dreams to expand her store and help her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov and her family completely depend upon rice farming. She has been cultivating rice as her major source of income for over 24 years. She primarily grows rice on her 2.5 hectares of farmland, and sells it to local traders in her village for profit each harvest season. She usually generates approximately 5.00 USD per day, which goes for her daily sustenance, allowances for her school-aged child, and other commodity costs.  Nov is 43 years of age, married, and a mother of three children, two of whom are employed while the last-born child is still a student. 

Nov is asking for a loan that will surely help improve her farming business. She would like to acquire a 700 USD loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice crops. With her profit from this investment, she will reinvest it back to a new cycle of crops growing and send her child to join a university program in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rhandy

texts.en:
Rhandy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Rhandy provides four-wheeler services that transport different kinds of products. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rhandy has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is from San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 67 years old. Anastacia is married and has 3 children. 

To make a living, Anastacia owns and operates a transport business.  She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns PHP 4,800 a month from these activities.  In 2007, Anastacia joined GDMPC.

Anastacia is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: repair her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Roger provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roger has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 51-year-old resident of Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte. Edna provides for her 3 children's needs from the little amount of PHP 13,800 she gains monthly from her vulcanizing shop business.  She has run this business for 7 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.  

Edna has been a member of GDMPC since this year.  She has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance for PHP 15,000 to purchase materials needed to provide service. Edna wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: buy materials for her vulcanizing business

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para realizar la compra de los materiales que estará utilizando en las nuevas siembras de maíz y frijol, comprandose el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, esto es necesario para prevenir la maleza y las plagas, al mismo tiempo fortalecer la producción de maíz y frijol.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse los materiales necesarios para el cultivo, del cual recibió una buena producción que le ha permitido los alimentos a su familia y cubrir los gastos necesarios como el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose decided to take out a new loan to purchase the materials he will be using in his new crops of corn and beans.  Buying fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides is necessary to prevent maladies and plagues and at the same time to strengthen production of the corn and beans.  

With the previous loan he was able to purchase the necessary materials for his crop which returned strong results and has provided his family with nutrition and money to cover necessary costs like school for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Herberth Ovidio

texts.es:
Herbert, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder aumentar el negocio invirtiendo en la compra de productos frescos como el pescado, el camarón, las conchas, que son necesarias para mantener el negocio de mariscos surtido y asimismo ofrecer a sus clientes una calidad mejor.

Como el préstamo anterior logró mejorar el movimiento del negocio, ya que ha obtenido una mejor clientela, en su familia considera que sus condiciones están mejorando, seguirá luchando por obtener mejores ventas y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Herberth is requesting a new loan in order to increase his business by investing in the purchase of fresh products such as fish, shrimp, and conches that are necessary to maintain his business of assorted seafoods. In this way, he will offer a higher quality to his customers. 

The previous loan succeeded in improving business activity, since he has obtained a better clientele. His family believes that their conditions are improving, and he will keep fighting to get better sales and continue to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, and conches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, conches, and various sizes of shrimp.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, she previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes to give her children a good quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, spare parts, and accessories

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is from San Carlos, Tukuran. She is 39 years old. Mary Jean is married and has two children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. She been in her business for 5 years and earns 7,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Mary Jean joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance

loans.name: Narcisa Del Pilar

texts.es: Narcisa hace 12 años abrió su pequeña tienda en su domicilio el cual está en Vergeles norte de Guayaquil. A sus 55 años vive sola ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y es divorciada, empezó el negocio porque quería tener un medio de ganar dinero pero sin salir de su casa, así fue cómo surgió la idea la cual hizo realidad con la ayuda de sus hijos. Después de varios años y gracias a otro crédito a podido agrandar su negocio. Trabaja en su tienda todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche como ahí mismo vive no tiene ningún problema con el horario, en su tienda vende productos de primera necesidad como es arroz, azúcar, granos, enlatados, artículos de limpieza, snacks,  etc. También se ayuda con el alquiler ya que tiene un departamento sin utilizar el cual arrienda. Su mayor temor son las enfermedades ya que no puede atender cuando eso pasa, espera obtener el crédito para poder comprar mercadería sobre todo confetis y lácteos. Le gustaría poder aumentar sus ventas y que su negocio crezca así a futuro poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Narcisa opened her small store 12 years ago in her house, which is in Vergeles, north of Guayaquil. At 55 years old she lives alone, as her children are older and she is divorced. She began the business because she wanted to have a means of earning money, but without leaving her house. So it was that the idea came to her and became reality with the help of her children. After some years, and thanks to another loan, she has been able to expand her business. 

She works in her store every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Because she lives right there, she doesn’t have any problem with the schedule. In her store, she sells essentials such as rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, snacks, etc. The business also helps with the rent, since she has a space without having to lease. Her greatest fear is becoming ill, because she cannot work when this happens. 

She hopes to obtain a loan in order to be able to purchase goods – most of all, sweets and dairy products. She would like to be able to increase her sales and for her business to grow, so that in the future, she can remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Segundo Sebastian

texts.es: Segundo vive en Vergeles norte de la ciudad, a sus 52 años se encuentra soltero y sus hijos son mayores e independientes. Lleva 2 años con la venta de frutas en especial la venta de frutas, también realiza fletes ya que la camioneta donde distribuye el producto es suya. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y lo realiza con una persona, entre los productos que oferta está el coco, piña, plátano, naranjas, sandia, cuando termina sus productos retorna con su familia. Empezó este negocio porque a su edad no podía conseguir empleo en una empresa, además es rentable. Con el préstamo que solicita comprara frutas para vender y también para hacerle algunas reparaciones a su camioneta, espera subir sus ventas y disminuir los gastos. Espera a futuro poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Segundo lives in Vergeles, north of the city. He is 52 years old and single, and his children are grown up and independent. He has been selling fruit for the past two years, and he also rents out his truck, which he also uses for distribution. His work starts very early and he works with another person, and among the products he offers are coconuts, pineapples, bananas, oranges and watermelon. When he is done selling the products he returns to his family. He started this business because at his age he wasn't able to find work at a company, plus it's lucrative. With the loan that he is requesting, he plans to purchase fruits to sell and also make some repairs to his truck. He hopes to increase his sales and lower his expenses. He hopes in the future to finish building his home.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts, pineapples, bananas, oranges and watermelons, and to repair his truck.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta, se encuentra solicitando un prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de platillos, en los cuales se utilizan por ejemplo el aceite, maiz, gas, yuca y condimentos, estos productos permitiran que Marta continue brindando un buen servicio a los clientes. 

Con el prestamo anterior, manifiesta que su experiencia ha sido positiva, manteniendose en las ventas a sus clientes y con ingresos estables que le ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades, considera que Kiva a traves de estos prestamos le ha ayudado mucho.
texts.en: Marta is requesting a loan to invest in materials to make her meals, such as oil, corn, propane, yucca and condiments. This products will allow her to continue providing a good service to her customers. She says that her experience with her previous loan has been positive, with her maintaining her sales and having stable income to cover necessities. She thinks that through these loans Kiva has helped her a lot.

loans.use: To purchase oil, corn, propane, yucca and condiments.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Made and the other members of the Karanjung Lestari 1 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Made hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Made will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months to be used for fattening.  With her profits, she will help support her family of two by supplementing their income. Her husband can’t work because of a heart attack.  Ultimately, Ni Made hopes that increased income will enable her to pay for her husband's medicine and also for their future needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Vidal Claudio

texts.es:
Vidal vive en la ciudad de chincha, Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia, como buen peruano le gusta mucho nuestra comida y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es la riquísima Carapulcra, por motivos económicos Vidal solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundarias pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor.

Vidal trabaja como lustrador de zapatos, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque le gusta realizarlo con esmero y es muy conocido.

Vidal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva por darle su gran apoyo por segunda vez ya que gracias a ello el podrá apoyar a un familiar que se encuentra grave de salud, ya que podrá llevarla al hospital de otra ciudad y podrá pagar los medicamentos y consultas medicas; con lo cual su familiar podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir luchando para cumplir su sueño:” Ser Profesor”.
texts.en: Vidal lives in the city of Chinca, which is named for the group of the same name that was celebrated for its agricultural advancements and maritime prowess. Today, Chincha has an incredible mixture of cultures, including a high Afro-Peruvian population, due to the remnants of its indigenous past and the influences of the Spanish empire. The city, along with others nearby on the Pacific coast, was damaged by strong earthquakes in 2001 and 2007, but it has endured, as it has for much of its history. As good Peruvians, the people really like their food, and one of the most popular dishes is the delicious Carapulcra, a traditional stew. Because of a lack of resources, Vidal was only able to study through his junior year of high school, but he would have liked to have studied to be a teacher. He works as a shoe-shiner about seven hours a day and can tend up to 30 customers per day. He believes his work is going well because he does it with care and is very well known. Vidal is very thankful for the Kiva lenders for their big support for the second time, because thanks to that he has been able to support a relative who is very ill. He will be able to take her to a hospital in another city and pay for the consultations and medicines, with which his relative will be able to have a better quality of life and he can continue fighting to fulfill his dream of becoming a teacher.

loans.use: pay for medical treatments and medicines.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is an energetic farmer living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She devotes most of her time working at the rice fields, particularly growing rice to sell for profit. Her spouse is also involved in the same type of business to secure their family financially. They have many years of experience in this project and usually yield a better harvest each season. Ya is now 46 years old and has five children – two married children and three school-aged children. Ya anticipates providing her children with a higher education, so she is pursuing her farming business to promote them.

The truth is, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field. Also, with the remaining funds, she will purchase fertilizers for good growth of her crops. She hopes to develop her current business and make it more achieving in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 48, is married, has five children and is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. 

To make a living, Concepcion iruns a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Concepcion has been in business for 10 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from her store.

Concepcion is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2008, Concepcion joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made is 51 years old and lives in Mengwi, Denpasar Bali. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband works as a driver. Though Ni Made often helps her husband in his work, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Made is the head of the Karanjung Lestari 2 group, which is made up of eight neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the 3.5M IDR that Ni Made receives, she will purchase one sow for pig breeding. She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to start another business selling fresh fish.

loans.use: to purchase one sow.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is married with one child. She is 25 years old. She is engaged in the hog-raising business. Diana is a hardworking person, and she ensures that she does everything she can to provide for the needs of her family. To this end, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed for her business. She hopes that her hog-raising business will be better than before so she can pay off the loan ahead of time and buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, is married and has two children. Juanita has owned and operated a transportation service for five years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Raquel dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase agricultural supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of her garden. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Josefina dreams to expand her store and help her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her farm

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
She is a lovely mother blessed with five children; one of them below the age of 15. They make a happy home with her husband. This family of seven is living in a three room apartment house in the Mile 4 neighborhood of Nkwen area in Bamenda, North-West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in her life such as inadequate capital to start up a business, the poor health situation of family members, and lack of means to provide basic needs for the family. 

She intends to buy a motorbike and also operate a callbox business. This loan will help the community by providing easy and cheap transportation for the population, as bikes are very accessible to neighbourhoods. The callbox will ease communication needs of community members. The business (especially that of the callbox) will succeed because of her location, the demand for mobile phone products and her experience in running the business. The profits will be used to improve her life and that of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase call center accessories and a motorcycle

loans.name: Florence Bih

texts.en:
Florence is happily married and blessed with two children.  The family lives in a three-room house in the Ndamukong neighborhood of Nkwen, Bamenda, North West Region. She has faced many difficulties in her life including the death of her younger sister, lack of adequate financing to carry out her business activities, the death of her father and frequent health problems with her children. Joining the GHAPE program has brought her joy as she now believes in herself and can move forward with her life.

Florence will use her loan to buy feed for sale or retail and to buy secondhand dresses to sell. The loan will allow her to help the community by providing feed on short notice to poultry and pig farmers and low cost clothing to poor community members.  She will use the proceeds from her business to pay her children’s school fees and improve their healthcare. She plans to increase her family’s well-being and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase second hand dresses.

loans.name: Evodia Achick

texts.en:
Evodia Achick is married with six children; the family lives in a four bedroom apartment house at the NITOP 2 quarters of Bamenda North west region of Cameroon. She has faced enormous problems in her life including the death of her mother and sister, her husband not providing for the educational and health needs of their family, insufficient capital to conduct business and poverty within their family. For these reasons, Evodia Achick joined GHAPE and plans to use her loan to purchase wood for fuel, palm oil, rice, beans, sugar, flour, baking powder and other spices.  

Thru her business, Evodia Achick helps the community by providing fast food services for the busy, working urban dwellers. Because of the location of her business, her customers do not need to travel so far for food. She thinks this business will succeed because of its location, the high demand from the growing urban population and her experience in the business. With the business profit this loan will allow for, she will be able to provide for better clothing, health, education and a greater standard of living for her family. She will also be able to improve their housing conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, palm oil and other items.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is happily married and the family is blessed with six lovely children, four of them below the age of 15 years. She and the entire family are living in a two-room apartment house. They are living at New Lay Out, Nkwen, Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

Lots of challenges have been encountered by this lady such as the lack of adequate finances to start up a business and low income within the family, making it difficult to even take care of some basic needs such as education and health bills. Again, she lost her sister who was lending her a helping hand. She also had a motorbike accident and the disappearance of her brother to date. But her situation changed when she joined GHAPE.

She intends to use this loan in preparing her poultry farm, buying feed for the fowls, buying crates of day-old chicks, feeding trays, fowl vaccines, and drinkers (waterers). 

Her loan activity will help the community because it will improve on their nutritional needs, as protein will be on their tables at low and affordable prices. The fowl droppings will be use by women as manure for their farms. 

The venture will be successful because of the high demand for fowl products, that is, chicken and fowl droppings. The profits will be used to cater to her children’s education fees and hospital bills. She also will use the profits to acquire a parcel of land and to plough back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines, and to repair her fence.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Rashid. He is married, and has 2 children, aged 8 and 5. In 2001, Rashid established his false hair and jewellery business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-empowered and this is his sole source of income. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rashid has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bracelets, necklaces, diamond earrings and gold plated bracelets. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 580,000. 

In the future, Rashid plans to establish a branch in Bo, to own a house and to buy both a commercial and a private vehicle. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: False hair and jewellery.

loans.name: Sica Delphine

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Delphine Sica est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 06 ans et 01 an. Elle a une boulangerie où elle fabrique du pain destiné à la vente depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est composée des semi grossistes et des détaillants. En vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Delphine Sica envisage de fournir des soins médicaux adéquats pour ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Delphine Sica is 28 years old, married and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to a local school. The eldest child and the youngest child are 6 and 1 years old, respectively. She owns a bakery, where she has been making and selling bread for several years, and she gets her supplies at one of Benin's market. Her large and varied clientèle is made up of semi-wholesalers and retailers.

In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customer demand, Delphine Sica has requested and received a micro loan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's school expenses. Delphine Sica plans to provide her children with adequate health care and to meet her own needs.

loans.use: 2 bags of powdered sugar, 1 bag of salt, 3 boxes of yeast and 8 bags of wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, oils, Bijao leaves, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera necesaria la inversión de más cerdos en el negocio, su intención es adquirirlos cuando estan pequeños, su compra sera en un aproximado de cinco, ya que es la oportunidad de ampliar la granja, su objetivo es mantenerse siempre trabajando y darle continuidad al negocio.

El defecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues ha logrado mejorar sus niveles de venta, generando para su familia una mejor condición económica, ya que ha cubierto todos los gastos más necesarios.
texts.en:
Mauricio is asking for a new loan because he wants to buy more pigs for his business. His aim is to buy them when they are small. He wants to buy around five, as this will give him the opportunity to expand his farm. His goal is to keep working and keep the business going.  

The impact of the last loan was positive as it allowed him to increase his sales,  improving his family's economic situation as he covered all of his essential expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric to make slipcovers.

loans.name: Ep Afya Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chakupewa est enseignante (monitrice) dans une école primaire Afya Bora, qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est aussi ménagère. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un soudeur. Son crédit sera affecté dans l’achat de fourniture et matériels scolaires pour ses enfants durant cette rentrée scolaire de septembre notamment  (25 cahiers, stylos, sacs au dos, cartable, boite géométrique, etc.). Le reste d’argent de crédit sera affecte dans le projet d’habitat (30 planches, clous, sables, ciment, etc.). Il sied de signaler que cette cliente  vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Cette cliente est très ambitieuse dans ses rêves, ainsi, dans le futur, elle ambitionne créer sa propre école moderne privée. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
The customer, Chakupewa, is a teacher (instructor) in the primary school Afya Bora, which benefits from loans from the IMF Hekima. She is also a housewife. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of 4 young children. Her husband is a welder.

Her loan will be used to buy her children school supplies and equipment for the start of the new school year in September; 25 notebook, pens, rucksacks, school bags, math sets, etc. The rest of the money from the loan will be used in her home construction project (to buy 30 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.).

This customer has already been through 2 loan cycles with Hekima. She has ambitious dreams and therefore, in the future, plans to created her own modern private school. To finish off, she would like to thank Hekima for its micro financing program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 25 notebook, pens, rucksacks, school bags, math sets, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Patricia Lourdes

texts.es: Patricia desde muy joven empezó a ofrecer los servicios de corte y confección por que le gustaba, poco a poco con el pasar los años fue obteniendo más clientes por lo pudo comprar sus maquinas de trabajo. El negocio lo realiza sola sin ningún horario establecido ya que  más que un trabajo es un hobby por lo que se siente satisfecha consigo misma sobre todo porque de esa manera ayuda en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo es taxista y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio del barrio. EL crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de una bordadora que necesita para su taller ya que los bordados son más caros si los envía a otro proveedor y con esto también ampliaría sus ventas. Patricia sueña con tener un local grande donde pueda hacer costuras de todo tipo y así brindarle a su familia estabilidad.
texts.en:
Patricia started sewing for a living when she was very young because she enjoyed it.  Little by little, over the years she has attracted more and more customers and has been able to buy sewing machines for work.  She works alone and has no fixed work schedule, since it is more like a hobby for her than work.  She feels very self-satisfied because, more than anything else, she can help out with the home economy.  Her husband is a taxi driver and her children go to the neighborhood school.

The loan she is requesting is to buy an emboidery machine for her workshop because it is more expensive to outsource the embroidery work, and this will help her increase sales.  Patricia dreams of having a large shop where she can make all kinds of products and give her family stability.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Jessica Guadalupe

texts.es: Jessica es una joven emprendedora que vive en Fortín sector recientemente poblado por lo que solo cuenta con agua y luz, y las casas en su mayoría son de madera, caña o cemento.  Es aquí donde empezó su tienda hace dos años porque le gusta mucho el negocio y poder obtener su propio dinero ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos necesarios. Como es muy joven y soltera vive con sus padres y ellos le ayudan con la tienda cuando sale a comprar los productos. En su tienda vende productos de necesidad básica como arroz, azúcar, granos, fideos, etc. Espera obtener el crédito ya que piensa comprar productos de confitería para aumentar sus ventas ya que les gustaría arreglar la vivienda de sus padres.
texts.en: Jessica is a young entrepreneur who lives in Fortín, a recently established village that only has running water and electricity.  Most of the houses are made of wood, cane or concrete.  Here she set up a store two years ago and very much enjoys the business and being able to make her own money, since her parents did not have enough resources. Being very young and single, she lives with her parents and they help with the store when she has to go out to buy products.  In her store she sells essential items such as rice, sugar, grains, noodles, etc.  She hopes to receive the loan because she wants to buy confectionery products to increase sales so she can fix up her parent's dwelling.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, grain, noodles.

loans.name: Yénoukounmè Célestine

texts.fr: Âgée de 44 ans, Yénoukounmè Célestine vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Yénoukounmè Célestine ne vit plus avec son mari et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Yénoukounmè Célestine vit avec ses enfants et assure seule les différents besoins des enfants. Pour pouvoir y arriver, Yénoukounmè Célestine vend des boissons et divers articles (savons, etc) dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Yénoukounmè Célestine vend des fruits et des tomates, activités qu’elle exerce depuis cinq ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Yénoukounmè Célestine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitive sur le marché, Yénoukounmè Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Yénoukounmè Célestine s'approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Yénoukounmè Célestine sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Yenoukounme Celestine is 44 years old, she lives in Benin and stopped attending school at secondary level. Yenoukounme Celestine no longer lives with her husband and she has two dependent children who attend school. Yenoukounme Celestine lives with her children and assumes their various needs alone. In order to manage this, Yenoukounme Celestine sells drinks and various articles (soap, etc.) at a market in Benin. Parallel to this activity, Yenoukounme Celestine sells fruit and tomatoes, this is a business that she has been doing for five years and brings in a size-able income. Yenoukounme Celestine's clientele is growing. In order to improve her business and become more competitive, she wishes to increase her stock. Yenoukounme Celestine buys her products in Togo. Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and her income, Yenoukounme Celestine requests a second loan from ALIDé. She repaid the previous loan correctly.

loans.use: To buy drinks and various articles (tomatoes, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Ecole Afya Group

texts.fr: Le client Nahirimba est un enseignant (moniteur) dans une école primaire Afya , qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Il est aussi serviteur de Dieu, évangéliste dans une église locale pentecôtiste. Il est âgé de 50 ans, marié et père 10  enfants, parmi les quels il ya de responsables de leurs propres foyers. Son épouse est vendeuse de denrées alimentaire dans un petit marché. Son crédit sera affecté dans le projet d’habitat (achat 50 planches, clous, sables, ciment, etc.). Il sied de signaler que ce client  vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Ainsi, dans le futur, il ambitionne construire confortablement. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
The customer, Nahirimba, is a teacher (instructor) in the Afya primary school, which benefits from loans from the IMF Hekima. He is also a Servant of God, an evangelist in a local Pentecostal church. He is 50 years old, married and the father of 10 children, some of whom are responsible for their own households. His wife sells food products at a small market.

His loan will be used for a home construction project (to buy 50 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.). This customer has completed 2 loan cycles in the Hekima program. He therefore hopes to be able to construct his home comfortably in future. Finally, he would like to thank Hekima for its micro financing program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 50 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Victoria  Del Carmen

texts.es:
