La señora Victoria es una mujer incansable en transmitir el pan de la enseñanza ya que como vocación la trae en la sangre, Actualmente se  desempeña como maestra de secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío de la misma localidad, atendiendo 1 turnos diurno y impartiendo clases los fines de semana en la localidad donde vive, además su esposo es maestro de secundaria , su núcleo familiar se compone por 2 persona ella, su esposo y  1hijo, el que estudia en el  colegio de la misma localidad, Actualmente sigue estudiando la carrera universitaria de la especialidad de Matemáticas y Computación el que lleva su primer año, debido a eso tomo la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para ayudarse a los costos ya que de su salario familiar no le da para cubrir los gastos familiares y los estudios para la superación  profesional. Ya que el crédito lo utilizaría para el pago de aranceles universitarios en las carreras de matemáticas y computación

  .
texts.en:
Victoria is a tireless woman who transmits the importance of education because she has the vocation in her blood.  Currently, she is a teacher at a secondary institute called Rubén Darío in the city where she lives.  She has a day shift and also teaches on the weekends.  Her husband is a secondary teacher.  Her family is comprised of her, her husband and a son who studies at the local school.

She is currently in her first year of university studies of Math and Computers, and decided to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to help pay for education costs, since the family income does not cover household expenses and university studies.  She will use the loan to pay for college tuition and expenses for her math and computer degree.
  .

loans.use: To pay tuition and expenses related to a Math and Computer university degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic necessities in bulk (boxes of sugar, soap, pasta; sacks of rice, salt...)

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan a 31 ans, elle possède depuis 6 ans une boutique d'alimentation générale à Lomé. Elle engage aujourd'hui son premier prêt chez WAGES. Elle désire augmenter son stock en alimentation générale afin d'intensifier son activité. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits futurs dans son activité pour la faire davantage évoluer. Elle aimerait pouvoir ouvrir une nouvelle boutique et surtout avoir une condition qui lui permettra de se marier et d'avoir des enfants.
texts.en: Massan, age 31, has been running a general food shop in Lomé for the past six years. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to increase her stock of merchandise and bolster her activity. She plans to reinvest her profits in the continuous development of her business. She would like to open another store, and she would especially like to marry and start a family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for her store.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pupusas, comprandose el gas, el maíz, condimentos, harina, aceite, entre otros materiales para tener un mejor inventario para realizar las ventas cada día.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo de la inversión, ya que su negocio ha sido más productivo y ha tenido más capacidad para atender a los clientes, en su familia todo está bien considera que sus condiciones están siendo más estables a través del crecimiento del negocio y la perseverancia con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sonia is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in buying materials to make pupusas. She will natural gas, corn, condiments, flour, oil and more to have a better inventory to do her sales every day.

With the previous loan, she was able to have a positive effect with the investment. Her business has been more productive and has had a greater capacity to serve more customers. In her family, every thing is fine, considering that their conditions are more stable through the growth of the business and perserverance with the loans.

loans.use: to buy natural gas, corn, condiments, flour and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a thermal protection device and bands for a mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, residing at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  Erlinda is married and has two children.  To earn a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and from it she earns PHP 4,800 a month.

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  In 2011, Erlinda joined GDMPC.  In the future, Erlinda wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is from the village of Alinam.  She is twenty-seven years old, married, and has one child.  Marie Rose owns and operates a direct selling business, which sells clothing and shoe products in the local community.  Marie Rose has been engaged in her business for over three years. 

As of now, Marie Rose is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering.  She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ianrocel

texts.en:
Ianrocel, 34 years old, is a single entrepreneur of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, and is earning income from his business of buying and selling rice. It has been almost three years now and he earns 20,000 a month. 

To improve business, he wants to borrow the amount of 30,000 from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently to obtain more sacks of rice to sell. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia has been operating her retail store for three years, and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about PHP 300 a day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Leticia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. She previously accessed a loan of 12,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on displayed and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lucia fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay, a 48-year-old married woman and mother of five children, two of whom are already married, lives in the Baray district with her family and works as a local farmer there. She, together with her spouse, grows rice and red corn on their existing farmland to yield income for the family. Lay has been in this business for over 10 years and normally she can earn in the vicinity of 30,000 KHR per day.

To start growing red corn for the upcoming season, Lay needs additional capital for the purchase of farm supplies. She is therefore requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide spraying. Recognized as an honest and VIP client, Lay has received five previous loans from HKL. She hopes that this investment will help in developing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide spraying.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He operates a photography studio in a conducive environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business for two years. Previously, he was employed. He dreams of having a successful business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy photography papers and photo frames.

loans.use: To buy photography papers and photo frames

loans.name: Hellen Achola

texts.en:
Hellen is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of five and 13. All of them go to school.

Hellen runs a hotel, and has been in business for six years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase meat, rice, and many other things. In addition to this business, Hellen has no other source of income.

In five years Hellen would like to expand her business and open other branches. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Hellen says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, sugar, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Pear Group

texts.en: Greetings!!! This is Coleen is from Bulawayo. She is 43 years old, and is married, with 2 children. The eldest is doing Advanced Level and the younger one Ordinary Level. The client operates a catering business. She works at designated places and services the surrounding industrial market. She has been doing this business for the past 15 years. Coleen is requesting for a loan of $2250, so that she can purchase more catering equipment, which includes, plates. spoons and forks since her market is growing, and she intends to open a small restaurant in the Central Business District. This will mean that she will be exposed to a wider market, which can boost her profits or income. With the income generated from this loan, Coleen will be able to pay school fees and buy food for her family, since she is not employed and relies on self help. It will also go a long way in enabling her to set up her restaurant which she plans to open after she finishes paying the current loan.

loans.use: to replenish stock  as well as buy additional equipment for use in the business, for example more cutlery,

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 67 years old and married to Susan. They are blessed with three children. He has been earning a living from buying and selling second hand furniture, with a monthly income of 13,800 KES.

He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET  LTD which he plans to use to purchase more stock of tables and chairs. With the anticipated profit he plans to open another branch. His future hopes are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second hand tables, cupboards, and chairs.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 35 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He runs a general goods retail shop business in Eldama Ravine town and this has been his source of income for the last five years where he gets an average monthly profit of KES. 8,000. 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 40,000 after successfully paying the previous  loan. He intends to use the loan to purchase more items for resale in his general store. These items include bar soaps, washing powder, faces towels among other items he will also  be using part of the loan  for transportation of the goods from the wholesale shops to his store. 

He anticipates to get profits which he will use to expand his business as well as save some amount for the future. Benson hopes to improve his living standards as well as expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer in his Murang’a rural home in Central Kenya. He lives with his family of three children, two of whom are still in school. He has 21 years in active farming and currently sells his produce which includes maize, tea, coffee and beans to the local market. He runs a cereals retail business besides farming.

Richard has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump and a water tank both at 30,000 KES each. He says this will help in irrigating his farm and generate more income specifically from banana farming. He plans to boost his horticultural farming and educate his last two children as well.

Richards says lack of capital and undeveloped local markets are the main challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen  is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a bicycle where he  provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a viable business area  and his primary customers are local residents who require transport. He describes his biggest business challenge to be impassible roads especially during the rainy season. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare parts. His business goal is to diversify his business into taxi transportation services  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a tea tree business which she started through her own savings.

Priscilla learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The main challenges she faces are price fluctuation, inflation and finding customers.

Priscilla is applying for a loan of 22,022 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her future plan in five years time is to start a cereal and grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah lives in the Nanyuki area of the Central province in Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a tea tree business, which she started with her own savings.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the goal of accessing credit. The main challenges she faces are seasonal weather and finding customers.

Veronicah is applying for a loan of 22,022 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for her business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her future plans are to improve the living standards of her family and start a grocery-stall business.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Nanyuki area of the Central province in Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a tea tree farm. He started the business with his own savings.

Daniel learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the goal of accessing credit to improve his business. The main challenge he faces is seasonal weather.

Daniel is applying for a loan of 11,528 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for his business. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His future plan is to establish a cereal shop.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a resident of Malindi in Coast province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for three years. She also earns additional income from a farming business.

Rehema learned about Milango through a friend. She has an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal markets, purchasing stock and high transport cost.

Rehema is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase some maize flour, sugar, cereals, and chairs for her customers to sit, as well as other items for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and to save. She aspires to open a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: buy maize flour, sugar, cereals and chairs

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is engaged. She owns a boutique which she has been operating for ten years now. She started the business through her own small savings.

Furaha learned about Milango through friends.  She has the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. The challenges she is facing are taxes, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather.

Furaha is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenyan shillings to buy dresses and skirts for the boutique. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees for her children. Her future plans are to expand the business and start a transport business.

loans.use: Buy dresses and skirts to resell

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married. She owns a clothing shop that she has been operating for five years. She learned about Milango through friends and has the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of funds.

Rabecca is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes for her business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the business operation and expand it. She hopes to expand to the wholesale level.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim received considerable income after the repair of his three-wheeler vehicle. He has also earned some income from the battery charging shop. 

He wants to grow his business by applying for a 73,100 KES loan to add a stock of retail material to his shop, such as mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy stock of retail material, such as mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jesus Gerardo

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede apreciar atractivos turísticos como la laguna de “Huacachina, la cual se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura como el samboarding, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Jesus es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 6 años, sobre todo con el cariño y comprensión de su esposa; el trabaja como empleado en una zapatería de la ciudad donde vive; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es muy amable y pacientes con los clientes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jesus está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda como tarrajeo de paredes, colocar puertas y ventanas a su vivienda, de esta manera el podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y seguir trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jesús is 41 years old. He lives in Ica which is a city characterized by its warm and pleasant climate. Because of this, one can appreciate the attractive sights such as the lagoon “Huacachina” which is situated between beautiful dunes. In these dunes one can also practice adventure sports such as sand boarding. Apart from that, agriculture is also developing, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, Lima and kidney beans amongst others.    

Jesús is a very hard-working man. This is above all because with his work’s earnings he can cover the household expenses. And most of all to allow his small son of six years to get ahead, especially with the love and understanding of his wife. 

He works in a shoe shop in the city where he lives. He thinks he is doing well in his job because he is responsible and most of all because he is very kind and patient with his customers. He really wants to move forward. 

Jesús is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva because thanks to their great help he will be able to carry out some home improvements such as plastering the walls and putting in doors and windows. This way, he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family and continue to work very hard such that one day he can make his biggest dream come true: “finish building his home and provide a good education to his son.”

loans.use: to improve his house (plastering of walls, putting in doors and windows).

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. For the past 2 years, Moffat has owned and operated a retail shop for selling coconuts, a business she started through her personal savings. She also sells goats, mats and brooms.

Moffat learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Moffat's main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. 

Moffat is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy mats, coconuts, brooms and a machine for grinding the coconuts. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay off the loan. Moffat's future plan is to expand and have a container where she will sell at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy mats, coconuts, brooms and a machine for grinding the coconuts.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Kongowea area of the Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a retail shop, a business he has been operating for eight years. Apart from this, he owns a rental house from where he gets his salary.
Moses learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges he is facing are price fluctuation, inflation and market seasonality.
Moses is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to add stock of retail items like cups, plates, flasks, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family's standard of living. His plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock of items like cups, plates, flasks, etc.

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en: Dzendere is grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for their support. With the last loan, she was able to improve her living standards. She is taking out another loan of Ksh 80,000 to start a new business. Her goal is to own several businesses. She intends to use the loan to purchase a motorcycle. This will make her able to increase her income.The anticipated profits from the taxi business will be used to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Sakina, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children who go to school. She has had a hotel business for four years. She works  from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sakina's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy liters of cooking oil, chairs and a sack of rice and to pay school fees and household expenses. Sakina has repaid all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her business stock (a sack of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and some kilos of sugar). Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Sakina will share this loan with her group “Mungu Tubariki” which consists of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her late 30s, is single and has one child who attends school. She has had a beauty salon business for six years. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Josephine's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to add more salon equipment and to pay school fees and household expenses. She has repaid all her loans successfully. Josephine wants a loan to buy some missing salon equipment and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to open a designing business.

Josephine will share this loan with her group “Magu” which consists of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Milton Jaime

texts.es: Milton empezó su venta de pollos hace 9 años, primero vendía de poquito ya que no tenía mucho conocimiento de la crianza de estos animalitos, y para reducir sus pérdidas por alguna enfermedad. Al poco tiempo se dio cuenta que mejoraban sus ingresos por lo que se arriesgo aprendiendo un poco de alimentación y cuidado, luego compro una cantidad más grande para aumentar la producción, ahora tiene en su domicilio un lugar acondicionado para la crianza. La venta la realiza solo recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad principalmente por el Guasmo ya que por ahí vive y lo conoce lo que reduce el riesgo de asaltos con lo que perdería su mercadería. Está felizmente unido y su esposa es ama de casa. Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara pollo para la crianza, balanceado y material para adecuaciones. Espera a futuro poder abrir una distribuidora de pollos grande al por mayor.
texts.en:
Milton began his chicken-selling business nine years ago. At first business was slow as he didn't know much about raising chickens and how to reduce losses from disease. After a short time he realized his income was getting better so he decided to learn more about feeding and caring for the poultry. Then he bought more chickens to increase production. 

He sells the chickens in various parts of the town, but mainly in El Guasmo as that's where he lives. He knows the area well so he can reduce the risk of attacks from which he might lose his chickens. 

He is happily married and his wife looks after the home. With the loan Milton plans to buy more chickens, quality feed, and material for repairs. In the future he hopes to open a large warehouse and sell chickens wholesale.

loans.use: Buy chickens, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Boresha Group

texts.en:
Ally is in his late 40s and is married with two children who are going to school. He has been running a kiosk selling juice, sodas, water, and fruits.  He is really hardworking.  He works from 6 a.m. to midnight, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ally's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start building his kiosk room, bought a freezer and has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to finish building his kiosk room and restock the missing items in his kiosk. Ally's dream is to one day be able to open another big kiosk in a different area.

Ally will share this loan with his loan group "Boresha" which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to finish building his kiosk  room.

loans.name: Joel Ruben

texts.es:
Joel es un hombre de25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación;  con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres no puedo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que tanto deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo Joel trabaja como Obrero en una empresa de su ciudad, él se desempeña realizando funciones de control de calidad y labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder tarrajear, pintar y poner piso a su casa; de esta manera Joel contará con un ambiente adecuado y seguro donde pueda desarrollarse adecuadamente, así el seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Joel is 24 years old, single and lives in the city of Pisco. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic man who has a very strong desire to improve. With a lot of determination he completed his secondary studies. Because he had to work to support his parents, unfortunately, he could not study what he wanted most: business studies. But he still dreams of doing that someday. 

In his free time he likes to do sports and on some occasions he cooks a delicious Arroz con Pato (rice with duck) to share with his family. 

Thanks to the support of his parents, his great determination and his enthusiasm, Joel is now a worker in a company in his city. He carries out quality control checks and works around 10 hours a day. He thinks he is doing well because of his good performance and the kind way he treats his fellows. 

Joel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are offering he can carry out some home improvements. He wishes to plaster, paint and put in a floor in his house. This way Joel will have an adequate and safe surrounding where he can develop himself adequately. Like that, he will continue to strain himself and to work such that he can move ahead together with his family.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, maize, yucca, and plantain bananas

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, age 46, is married with five children. She resides in Tukuran. 

Brenda operates a fishing business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

This year, Brenda joined GDMPC. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a widow with six children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tukuran. 

Elsa operates a fishing business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 9,950 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Recently, Brenda joined GDMPC. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child who attends school. He is a money lender, a business he has been operating for two years. Apart from this, he is employed and earns a salary from his job. 

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is customers not paying on time, hence bringing about bad debts.

Alpha is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to increase float (electronic credits that serve as virtual currency in the mobile money industry). The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family and educate his child. 

His plan for the future is to open another money lending shop.

loans.use: To increase float (electronic monetary credits).

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing-sales business.

NWTF is re-listing Almira's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod is an industrious person who is married and has three children. He lives in a big house that is perfect for animal husbandry. This is why he has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. Little by little, with the passing of time, each year he has developed his business. 

Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Dilshod earns additional income from taxi driving. His children have become older and want a better quality of life. His wife helps him with the business. She is a seamstress who sews very wonderful dresses. They want to develop the business and from the profits buy all the things they need. However, their income is not enough for this. 

Dilshod is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Esta Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Esta, entrepreneur de talent, âgée de 34 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. La cliente est vendeuses de produits de maquillage de dames et sociétaire d'un salon de coiffure. Elle expose ses articles dans un salon de coiffure. En plus de cette activité, elle tresse et coiffer également les dames. Elle commença cette activité avec le crédit de Hekima. De ce fait, elle vient de réaliser 4 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Le défi majeur de son activité est la petitesse de son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  20 pièces de mèches. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et soutenir la scolarité de ses enfants. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Faida, is the advisor of the business group Esta. She is a talented entrepreneur, 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of five young children. She is a vendor of makeup for women and is an associate of a hair salon. She displays her products in a hair salon. In addition to this business, she makes braids and also styles hair for women. She started this business with a Hekima loan. In that regard, she just completed four cycles in this micro-loan program. 

The major challenge of her business is low capital. This new loan must serve to supply her with 20 hair extensions. In the future, she wishes to buy a plot of land and cover her children's school fees. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nagnimatou

texts.fr: Nagnimatou, âgée 32 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville. Spécialisée dans la vente des boîtes de conserve, des savons, des biscuites et des produits alimentaires depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses clients. Nagnimatou souhaiterait aider son mari à construire des chambres à louer dans leur maison afin de pouvoir mieux supporter les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Nagnimatou, aged 32, is married and the mother of four children, who are attending a school in the city. Specialized in selling canned foods, soaps, cookies, and other grocery items for a few years, she stocks up from one of the markets in Benin.

Concerned about bolstering her sales and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev with the aim of growing her extra revenues and helping with her children's education. Nagnimatou would like to help her husband to build rooms to rent out in their house, so as to support her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 boxes of milk, 6 boxes of sugar, and 15 boxes of macaroni

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mamy est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Esther rénové. Entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de  30 ans, mariée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. Son mari est travailleur d’une entreprise de gardiennage. La cliente est vendeuse des articles divers. Elle commença cette activité avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de Hekima. Le défi majeur pour cette cliente, est qu’elle a été dernièrement victime d’un incendie de sa maison, ce qui a négativement influencé ses affaires. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  25 kg de farines de manioc, de maïs, épices, etc.  Dans l’avenir, elle projette améliorer sa maison, encours de construction et agrandir son activité. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Mamy, is the advisor of the renewed business group Esther. She is an energetic entrepreneur, 30 years old, married, and the mother of five young children. Her husband is a worker at a security company. Mamy is a vendor of a variety of goods. She started this business with her own funds. Later on, she benefited from a Hekima loan. 

The major challenge for this client is that she was recently a victim of a fire in her house. This negatively impacted her business. This new loan must serve to supply her with 25 kg of cassava flour, corn, spices, etc. In the future, she plans to improve her house now being built and to expand her business. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 25 kg of cassava flour, corn, spices, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

NWTF is relisting Josefina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

NWTF is re-listing Juditha's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He runs a transport business to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years. Besides that, he does farming to supplement his income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business.  He dreams of expanding his business and buying a truck in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is 53 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He does poultry farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business since the year 2000. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming an established poultry farmer in the future. He needs a loan of 10,000 KES to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 24 years old. He is not married yet and has no children. He is very hardworking and clever and tries to find new ways for income and profit to provide his parents with high quality living conditions.  It’s for this reason that 4 years ago he began his own business with driving. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers.  

The faster developing of modern life makes Naimjon to be more progressive, and that’s why he wants to buy a new car to attract more clients. In this way he can develop his business further, but nowadays his income is not enough for buying a car, so he is asking for a loan to buy a new car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a hardworking 30-year-old married business lady. She sells rice to make a living. She has been operating this business for two years. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to add to her stock of rice. She has also learned how to manage her business since she has been trained in business management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: Agée de 24 ans, Blandine vit sous le toit de son mari et mère d'un enfant âgé de 08 ans et scolarisé. Elle fabrique du savon à base de la soude depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Blandine a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire. Ce surplus lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle envisage changer la toiture de ses parents avant la prochaine saison pluvieuse.
texts.en:
Blandine, aged 24, lives with her husband and is the mother of an 8-year-old child, who is in school. Blandine has been producing soap made from soda for a few years and gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about increasing her purchasing power and responding favorably to customer demands, Blandine requested and obtained financial support from Finadev with the aim of bolstering her business and growing her extra income. This surplus will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and to support herself. She envisions replacing her parents' roof ahead of the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of soda to make soap

loans.name: Yahaira Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Yahaira es una mujer dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, actualmente labora en el ministerio de educación de la localidad, desde hace 5 años, es casada con 1 hijo el que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones básicas para su desarrollo, actualmente se desempeña en el área  como responsable de Estadísticas.  
Una de las necesidades que la señora  Yahaira  atraviesa hoy en día es de Tramitar su Titulo como Licenciada  de Maestra de  Educación Primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar la tramitación de su titulo el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yahaira is a woman dedicated to her work and her family. For five years now she has been working in the ministry of education in her town. She is married with one child for whom she has to provide the basic development conditions. She is currently working as responsible in the area of statistics. 

One of the difficulties Yahaira is presently going through are the necessary bureaucratic steps and paperwork to have her degree in primary education officially certified. The realization of her big dream is the result of a lot of effort she put into it. Because of the need mentioned, she decided to visit CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to carry out the official certification of her degree. This will help her even more in her work place because of the academic level it represents. In turn, her living conditions will also improve.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in primary education to be officially certified.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 42 years old and married with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of grocery items for resale. She has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Lilibeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 68 years old and has three children. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 14 years and has employed one person. Besides that, she does farming and owns rental houses. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy maize, beans, green grams, rice and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, green grams, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 07 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Komlan est cultivateur de profession. Il exerce son activité en REGION CENTRALE  depuis 1999. Homme de 49ans, père de 06 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école, Mr Komlan responsable du groupement PUITS DE JACOB dont il fait partie il y a un moment sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un second prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Il voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique, augmenter sa superficie cultivable et prendre soin de sa famille. Les autres membres  sont  aussi dans le domaine de l’agriculture et espèrent qu’avec le fruit de ce crédit prendre en charge leurs familles.
texts.en: Helped by seven persons in operating his business, Mr. Komlan is a farmer by trade. He has been operating in  REGION CENTRALE since 1999. He is a 49-year-old man and the father of six children, all in school. Mr. Komlan is the official of the group PUITS DE JACOB in which he has been a member for quite a while. He is requesting aid from WAGES with a second loan to supply himself with work tools. He would like to open a store in the future, increase his arable land, and take care of his family. The other members are also in farming and hope to support their families with the fruits of this loan.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia conformada con su esposa y cuatro hijos, solamente él trabaja en el hogar, se dedica a la venta de panes con pollo, éste lo aprendido por unos amigos con quienes trabajaba anteriormente, hoy día tienen negocio propio, sin un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.

Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los panes como lo es embutidos, pollo, vegetales, carne, pan,  aceite, que son necesarios para que pueda continuar en la produccion de la venta, este crédito le permitirá surtir el inventario.

El objetivo de Jose es crecer en el negocio, tener otras zonas de acceso donde pueda incrementar sus clientes, ya que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, made up of his wife and four children. He is the only one in the home that works. He works selling bread rolls with chicken. He learned this from some friends that he worked with previously. Today they have their own business, without established hours of operation to tend to customers.

He is applying for a loan to invest it in ingredients for making the breads, like sausages, chicken, vegetables, meat, bread, and oil, which are necessary to be able to continue production of the product. This credit will allow him to stock his inventory.

Jose's goal is to grow his business and have other access areas where he can increase his customer base, since that will allow him to increase his income and live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy sausage, chicken, vegetables, meat, bread, and oil.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: Dilma tiene 29 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Dios Proveerá, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil. Es una familia unida y trabajadora, ellos residen en la comunidad de San Nicolás, de la cuidad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Dilma se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, lo inicio desde hace 16 años y el oficio lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella se dedicaba al mismo rubro, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, lo abre desde las 7:00 am y lo cierra a las 6:00 pm, la ventaja que tiene es que cuenta con numerosa clientela y no tiene mucha competencia. Dilma solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de dos fardos de ropa usada que el ayudaran para poder surtir su negocio de prendas y estilos diferentes que estén a la moda y así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes. El único problema que enfrenta es cuando no tiene dinero comprar fardos de ropa y poder surtir su negocio, se ve en muchas dificultades por lo tanto ella busca el apoyo de FAMA para hacer crecer su negocio. Dilma ha sido cliente de FAMA durante 15 ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Dilma is 29 years old, and is a member of the solidarity group, "Dios Proveerá" (God will provide). She is married, has three children, and her husband is a mason. They are a very tight knit, hardworking family, and they live in the community of San Nicolás, which is in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. Dilma makes a living selling used clothing, and began running her small business 16 years ago. She learned the trade from her mother, and presently runs her business out of her home, beginning at 7:00 every morning and working until 6:00 every evening. The advantage of her business is that she has a large customer base and not much competition in her area.

Dilma is requesting this loan in order to purchase packages of used clothing to further stock her business. She hopes, with this investment, to offer a wider range of styles and options to her customers. The only problem she faces is that she does not have enough money to buy the packages of clothing on her own, and she has therefore sought support from FAMA to grow her business. Dilma has been a client of FAMA for 15 business cycles, and has a great history of prompt loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase packages of used clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for one year. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a motorcycle in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mical

texts.en: Mical is 38 years old, married, and has six children who are in school. She does tailoring for a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, she has become financially knowledgeable through the trainings she attended. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old, married, and has five children who are in school. He does farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his savings skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming an established farmer in the future. He has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is taking out a loan to invest in her spare parts selling business. She narrates that the last loan enabled her to increase her monthly income through the sale of clothes, and that has made her able to own another business. Asia dreams of expanding her business and opening new businesses even as she offers a quality life for her children. She is taking out this loan to purchase spare parts for her second business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her second business.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en: Hennie is a 53-year-old resident of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. For 10 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband, Hennie has provided her child's needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Hennie wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en: Ma. Liza is 47 years old. She is married to Rodante. Her goal is to improve her hog-raising business to support her family. She has been in this business for almost 7 years earning profits of 7,000 PHP per month that she uses for their basic necessities. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has the strong determination to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life. Right now, she is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She believes that this loan will contribute a lot to make the business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a widow and has 12 children. Pacita is 57 years old, residing at Mansabay, Bajo,Lopez Jaena. Pacita owns and operates a general store. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Pacita joined GDMPC. In the future, Pacita wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Lorna is a very active member of Yehu who has shown great interest to progress in life. She took out a loan which enabled her to improve her living standards and her monthly income. Demand for more varieties of fresh produce has increased so she is taking out another loan in the amount of KSH 40,000 to invest in her current business so as to increase her sales and fulfill her customer demands. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables for sale. This will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Inderetsi Group

texts.fr:
Damien fait partie du groupe Indereretsi  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 42 ans et est marié  à Acquline, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants. L’un a 7ans et l’autre 9ans. Ils étudient tous.
Il prend soin d’un neveu qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  la bière et de  viande (chèvres) dans son bistrot depuis 3ans. 
Il est à son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres pour la vente de  viande, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter sa propre parcelle pour construire  sa propre maison. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Damien is part of the group Indereretsi and lives in Bujumbura. He is 42 years old and married to Acquline, a teacher. Together they have two children, 7 and 9 years old. They are both students. He takes care of a nephew, who is a student.

Damien has had a business selling beer and meat (goat) in his bistro for three years. 

He is on his first loan at Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy many goats to sell meat, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy his own plot of land to build his own house. Aside from this, he would like to see his children go to school and complete their education.

loans.use: to buy many goats to sell meat in his bistro

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 29 years old and a hardworking man with a great desire to progress in life. He and his wife have two small children and try to do the best for them. They live in a house he built due to his great dedication.
He is one of the more successful businessmen of his town. For more than four years, he has been busy producing and selling grids (fencing). He makes grids from metal. He knows all aspects of his business very well. His experiences and skills help him to develop his business and in this way improve his living condition. Naimjon wants to develop his business further but his income is limited and he needs your help.
He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy metal for producing more grids. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy metal for producing grids.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 47 years old, married and has four children. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for 32 years. He also runs a motorcycle transport business. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a pickup truck in the future for easy transportation of goods. Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 10 bags of green grams and two bags of maize.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of green grams and two bags of maize.

loans.name: Bassinadou Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupement constitué de femmes et d’hommes tous lancés dans l’agriculture en RÉGION CENTRALE, madame Naka est mère de 06 enfants. L’ainé est âgé de 33ans et le dernier 10ans. Elle est veuve et âgée de 50ans. Pour permettre à ses enfants de grandir dans de bonnes conditions, elle cultive la terre. Aidée par 01 personne, madame Naka sollicite un second crédit dans notre institution pour acheter des intrants agricoles. Il y a de cela 17ans qu’elle est dans cette activité et espère qu’avec le profit tiré construire une maison, transformer son champ en une ferme agricole.
texts.en:
The official of a group composed of men and women who all work in agriculture in RÉGION CENTRALE, Ms. Naka is the mother of six children. The oldest child is 33 years old, and the last is 10. She is a 50-year-old widow. To enable her children to grow up under good conditions, she farms the land. 

Helped by one person, Ms. Naka is requesting a second loan from our institution to buy farm inputs. She has been doing this work for seventeen years and hopes to build a house with the profits earned and to transform her field into a large farm.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Nancy

texts.fr:
La dame Nancy fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est sociétaire du guichet qui se situe à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est à son 4ème crédit à l’IMCEC  et veut un renouvellement de 150000 F CFA pour pouvoir acheter des draps de lit, des robes pour enfants des parfums pour revendre durant la période des fêtes.
Nancy participe à la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Avec une augmentation de revenus, elle souhaite appuyer sa fille dans sa scolarité.
texts.en:
The lady, whose name is Nancy, has had a trading activity for more than ten years. She is married and a mother. She is a shareholder/member of the branch, which lies around 22km from the main town. She is on her fourth loan from IMCEC and would like a renewal of 150,000FCFA to be able to buy bed linen, children's dresses and perfumes to resell during the festival period. 

Nancy contributes to the household's daily expenditure. She would like to help out with her daughter's education with an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy bed linen, children's dresses and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
Quintin es un hombre de49 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, tiene un hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y siempre ha sido su razón principal para esforzarse y salir adelante, él es una persona amable, trabajador y entusiasta; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar pequeños viajes con su hijo y en algunas de estas ocasiones aprovechan la oportunidad para comer un delicioso Chupe de Camarones.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Quintin trabaja en su pequeño negocio de elaboración de puertas y ventanas metálicas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana él inicia su labor, dedicando un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él cree que le va bien por la dedicación que pone en sus trabajos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Quintin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales, tales como: pintura, metales, barniz, entre otros; de esta manera Quintin contará con los materiales necesarios para poder desarrollar su trabajo, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, así el seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante y superarse.
texts.en:
Quintin is 49 years old, and lives in the city of Camaná. He has one adult son, who has always been his motivation for working hard and getting ahead in life. Quintin is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who never had the opportunity to pursue a professional career, since he had to work to help his parents support their family. However, he would have liked to continue his studies at a university. In his free time, he likes to take short trips with his son and enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the delicious, "Chupe de Camarones" (shrimp sucker). 

Quintin works hard every day at his metalworking shop crafting metal doors and windows. He begins work very early each morning, and works about 12 hours per day. He believes that business is going well because he is kind to all his clients, and he puts a great amount of effort and dedication into every item he makes.

Quintin is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and plans to use the resources from this loan to purchase materials for metalworking, such as: paint, metal and varnish, etc. He hopes that this investment will increase his ability to complete orders for customers, and will increase his overall sales, helping him to get ahead and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as: paint, metal, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung is 50 years old, married and has four children, three of whom have jobs. She lives in Baray District with her family. Ung doesn’t want to rely only on her husband’s and children’s income. She is confident that she also is able to generate income to help improve her family’s living conditions. Recently she has been involved in selling papaya salad in a public gathering area of her community, earning approximately 40,000 KHR each day. Her husband manages a fishing-raising business in their village. Due to the lack of capital, Ung’s spouse cannot maintain his fish-raising business. For that reason, Ung would like to take out a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase 5,000 small fish to raise and 50 kg of feed to fatten them. She hopes to enhance her family-owned businesses as well as her family's living status.

loans.use: to purchase 5000 heads of small fish for raising and 50 kg of feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. For eight years, he has earned income by providing transportation services to support the needs of his three children. He earns 15,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 31-year old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. Roland wants to borrow 35,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Soucoupapaye Group

texts.fr:
Soucoupapaye est créé le 11 Mai 2001. Les membres fondatrices sont solidaires et entretiennent des relations de bon voisinage.
Mme Fatou est l'emprunteur vedette et sur la photo, elle est debout à droite avec la main levée. C'est une femme veuve âgée de 58 ans et mère de 06 enfants (04 filles et 02 garçons) âgés entre 20 et 09 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer sa boutique qui est gérée par son fils. Les bénéfices serviront à une meilleur prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Soucoupapaye was created on May 11, 2001. The founding members are together in solidarity and maintain good neighborly relations. 

Ms. Fatou is the featured borrower. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right with her hand raised. She is a widow, 58 years old, and the mother of six children (four girls and two boys), from 9 to 20 years old. With this loan, she is going to provide a boost to her store, which is managed by her son. The profits will be used to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy various goods for her store

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné s’active dans la vente d’encens et de bijoux : bracelets et colliers depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère  de famille. Ngoné commence sa journée à 8 h et la termine à 18h du soir. Elle demande un crédit de 100000F CFA pour acheter de l’encens et préparer la fête en vendant des bracelets pour enfants et des colliers.
Elle appui son mari dans la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêt à porter avec l’appui d’une institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Ngoné has been active for over five years in selling incense and jewelry: bracelets and necklaces. She is married and a mother with a family. Ngoné starts her day at 8:00 AM and finishes at 6:00 PM. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to buy some incenses and to get ready for the holiday by selling bracelets for children and necklaces.

She supports her husband in covering day-to-day household expenses. 

Her ambition is to open a store selling ready-to-wear clothing with the support of a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy incense, bracelets, and children's necklaces to sell

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gora est un agriculteur  depuis plus de 20 ans. Il vient solliciter IMCEC pour la première fois et demande un crédit de 250000F CFA  pour acheter des intrants agricoles, de l’engrais et 20 pots de choux.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et travaille pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de cette dernière. S’il avait un fond solide, il augmenterait sa production maraichère.
texts.en: Mr. Gora has been a farmer for twenty years. He is here to requested a loan from IMCEC for the first time. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs CFA to buy some farm inputs, fertilizer, and 20 containers of cabbages. He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses and works to improve the food situation. If he had a solid basis, he would increase production from his market garden.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, fertilizer, and 20 containers of cabbages

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Abdou est un jeune cultivateur, qui exerce ce métier depuis 12 ans. C’est un homme assidu au travail qui démarre sa journée de 7h du matin à 19h du soir.
Il est marié mais vit avec ses parents ; et participe à la dépense quotidienne.
Abdou veut un crédit de 50000 FCFA avec lequel il va acheter deux pots de choux, 7 sacs de fumiers et de l’engrais.
Il envisage s’il a un fond, d’acheter une motopompe pour augmenter sa capacité de production.
texts.en:
Abdou is a young farmer who has been practising this trade for the past 12 years. He is a hard-working man who begins his day at 7am and finishes it at 7pm. He is married but lives with his parents and contributes to the daily expenses.

Abdou would like a loan of 50,000FCFA in order to buy two pots of cabbages, seven sacks of manure and fertilizer. If he has the money, he is planning to buy a motor pump in order to increase his production capacity.

loans.use: to buy two pots of cabbages, seven sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kenia Azucena

texts.es: Kenia, de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en San Juan Pueblo, municipio de la Masica Atlántida. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace dos años de un salón de belleza y venta de productos. Ofrece a sus clientes, peinados, cortes de pelo, alisados, planchados, tintes, tratamiento de uñas etc. también vende productos como tintes, cremas, champoo, glases, quita esmalte etc. el negocio lo tiene en su casa y es muy conocida en la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para surtir de productos de belleza para uso en el salón y para vender. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para sacar adelante a su familia y poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 32, is married and has three children.  She lives in San Juan Pueblo in the Masica municipality in Atlántida.

She has had her own business, a beauty salon and beauty product sales, for two years.  She offers her customers hairstyling, haircuts, straightening, ironing, hair color, and nail treatments, etc.  She also sells products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, and nail polish remover, etc.  She has the business in her house, and she is very well-known in the community.

She will use the requested loan to buy beauty products to use in the salon and to sell.  Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get her family ahead and to be able to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, and nail polish remover, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos domésticos y lácteos, este negocio comenzó con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayuda a atender a los clientes, no tienen un horario establecido y si cuenta con mucha experiencia.

Él solicita un préstamo para comprarse productos como queso, crema, quesillo, para tener abastecido el negocio, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener surtido en el negocio, podrá atender mejor a los clientes con productos frescos.

El objetivo de Manuel es tener un negocio más grande, que a través de los préstamos logre estabilizar la mercadería, ya que esto le mejorará las condiciones para generar ganancias así como las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family —his wife and his children— and works managing a store for home and dairy products. This business started with the support of his wife who helps him to attend to customers. They don't have set hours of operation and they have a lot of experience. 

He is applying for a loan to buy products like cheese, creme, and fresh cheese to be able to supply the business. This purchase will allow him to grow and keep the business stocked. He will be able to better attend to his customers with fresh products.

Manuel's goal is to have a bigger business. Through the loans he could stabilize the merchandise, since this will improve conditions to generate income and the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and fresh cheese.

loans.name: Cairus

texts.en: Cairus is 20 years old, married, and has three children. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. He also does farming to generate more income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become more knowledgeable about saving because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Cairus has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 39 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. To earn a living, Stephen makes shoes and sells them. He operates his business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. He also does farming to supplement his income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to increase his stock. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy leather, gum, linings, and shoe soles.

loans.use: To buy leather, gum, linings, and shoe soles

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a dedicated mother who works hard to cater for the needs of her family. She continues to sell food stuffs, making them from her home. Fatuma wants to take advantage of the festive season of Ramathan. She wants to increase her supplies and offer a variety of food stuffs. She sells her foods in a strategic place along a busy street where most people gather to buy snacks and juice during the opening hours in the evening after a day of fasting. She says that her business earns her a good profit.

Fatuma is asking for another loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other flavours and ingredients to make more food stuffs for sale. She is very grateful to Kiva and Yehu for their support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other flavours and ingredients

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo y su familia, no tiene hijos, por el momento nadie depende económicamente de sus ingresos, el negocio ella lo aprendido con su esposo, trabaja desde su casa,  tiene buena experiencia para atender las demandas de la granja. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, ya que necesita crecer en la granja y este crédito le ayudará brindandole los recursos económicos para poder fortalecer el negocio, ya que estará engordando un mayor número de cerdos.

Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y aumentar su clientela,  también poder adquirir su propia casa, para tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Idalia works raising pigs. She lives with her husband and his family. She doesn't have children and for the moment no one depends economically on her income. She learned the business with her husband. She works from home and has good experience to attend to the demands of the farm.

She is applying for a loan to buy pigs, since she needs to grow the farm. This credit will help her, giving her the economic resources she needs to be able strengthen the business, since she will be fattening a greater number of pigs.

She aspiration is to grow in the business, increase her customer base, and also to get her own house, in order to have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jjamer Samuel

texts.es: jjamer  tiene 20 años de edad  y conoce perfectamente los intereses de la juventud, especialmente de aquellos que usan la motocicleta como su primer medio de transporte o trabajan transportando gente, porque necesitan usar  una buena combinación de accesorios que proyecten una imagen de libertad y elegancia. Esto fue en lo que pensó JJamer para dar inicio a su idea de negocio, mediante el cual vende cascos, chalecos, mangas, luces calcomanías y visores, accesorios   que exhibe  en la puerta de su vivienda, ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad. El trabaja  de lunes a domingo, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y   vende a su principal mercado de motociclistas. Sus compras las realiza con una frecuencia quincenal, de contado en almacenes especializados en estos accesorios y así mismo realiza sus ventas. Este negocio nació hace 1 años y poco a poco ha logrado sostenerse y aunque tiene un potencial de crecimiento,  jjamer no lo ha explorado, porque tiene el desafío de no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertirle y expandirse. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cascos, chalecos, mangas, luces, calcomanías y visores, en mayor volumen  con lo que obtendría descuentos por compras en mayor volumen, que traduciría en mas utilidades, porque quiere continuar sus estudios y fortalecer su capital de trabajo, para estabilizar los ingresos que generan bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, con el que sueña un futuro  exitoso.
texts.en:
Jjamer is 20 years old, and is well acquainted with aspects of youth culture, especially with all things related to motorcycling. Many young people in his area use motorcycles as their primary mode of transportation, or work for a motor-taxi service transporting customers around town.
