In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of cleaning products to be able to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is planning to open his own detergents shop.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of cleaning products

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is very industrious. He is single, a student and an entreprenuer from Anquiray. During weekends, he helps his parents generate income to supplement his studies, too. He sells plastic ware such as basins and mats. He has been doing it for three years now. He earns P3,000 each month selling these items. He is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to further increase his income by selling more plastic ware. He will buy more basins, mats, hangers and pots to sell. 

In the future, Ismael would like to keep generating income for  his family so he can also pay his matriculation fees on time.

loans.use: to buy more basins, mats, hangers and pots to sell

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old; he owns a food stall in Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He has been selling food for the past two years.

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also in the expansion of his business. 

He hopes to educate all his children to college level and see them lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: La Bonne Semence De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Jeannine est La coordonatrice de son groupe La Bonne Semence de Ouanaminthe.  Elle est mariee. Elle a 6 enfants.

Jeannine habite dans la région de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son  commerce de chaussures de tennis pendant les 5  dernières  années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir pour acheter chaussures de sport pour femmes, hommes et enfants. Jeannine espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise.

Des autres membres de sont groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon le produits divers et cosmetiques, quincaillerie, etc. Jeannine dit que son défit principal c'est devenir  un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Jeannine is the coordinator of her group La Bonne Semence de Ouanaminthe. She is married, and she has six children.

Jeannine lives in the region of OUANAMINTHE in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She has been managing her tennis shoes business for the last five years. 

She would like to use this loan to invest in buying athletic shoes for women, men, and children. Jeannine hopes that this loan will help her to expand her enterprise.

Some other members of her group have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal, a general store, cosmetics, hardware, etc. Jeannine says that her main challenge is to become a major merchant.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 46 years old and has six children. To earn a living, she does tailoring and also repairs shoes. She operates her business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. She also farms to supplement her income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Rose has requested a loan of 25,000 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en: Prudencio is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. He is 33 years old. Prudencio is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Prudencio makes and sells iced buko (pie) to sell. Prudencio been in business for 5 years and earns PHP 6,000 per month for these activities. In 2011, Prudencio joined GDMPC. Prudencio is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 52 years old and sells detergents in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three children. Her business has been in operation for the past two years and it is doing great. 

This is her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more detergents to re-sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more detergents.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Pum is a 43-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Pum is in the business of selling a variety of things, including grocery items, spices, canned foods, noodles, and beverages in a local market of the province. Her husband is her motivation in this retail business. She earns an average of 5.00 USD per day. 

Pum would like to refill her stock of merchandise again in order to satisfy her customers. Due to the lack of insufficient capital, she has applied for a loan of 250 USD to purchase more commodities such as spices, canned food, smoked fish, beverages, and other miscellaneous things. Through this purchase, Pum is hoping to develop her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities such as spices, canned food, smoked fish, beverages, and other miscellaneous things.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is from Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She contributes to her family's finances through her business making pots. She’s a 59-year-old married woman with 9 kids, who tries her best to earn profit. For 25 years, she has managed this business. She earns about PHP 4,500 per month. For the time being, she’s needs to buy more clay to use in her business. She joined GDMPC just this year and asks for a loan of PHP 5,000. Rosalinda desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 44 years old and widowed with three children, one daughter and two sons, who have their own employment at a garment factory. She lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province where rice farming is a common way to earn a living and she has been farming rice for ten years to support her family, supplementing her family’s income by selling a sweet fermented (alcoholic) black rice dessert. The current business earns her approximately US$8 per day and she manages to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the third loan for Sarom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of US$1,000. With this loan, she is going to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to their workplace. She hopes this loan will enable her children to save some time in traveling back and forth to work so they can help with the family’s business and housework. Sarom also hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to their workplace

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has three children. She sells clothes and panties in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Grace uses her income to pay her children's school fees as well as a few household expenses. Grace will use the loan to purchase clothing and panties in bulk. With her new profits, Grace plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase outerwear and panties in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch and sardines.

loans.name: Dukomezegusenga Group

texts.fr:
Barnabé fait partie du groupe  Dukomezegusenga et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 40 ans et est marié à  Euphrasie, commerçante de restaurant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 à  16 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce  des objets en métaux  depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’objets en métaux(des carcasses des vieux véhicules,...) à revendre en Ouganda, pour gagner plus. 

 Grâce aux bénéfices de son commerce,  il voudrait  avoir un grand capital pour avoir plus de bénéfices
texts.en:
Barnabé is part of the group Dukomezegusenga and lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Euphrasie, a restauranteur. Together they have four children, from 7 to 16 years old, who are all students. 

Barnabé has been dealing in metallic objects for four years. 

He is on his eighth loan at Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy many pieces of metal (junked vehicles, … ) to resell in Uganda, so as to earn more. 

Thanks to the profits from his business, he would like to have a large amount of capital to have more profits.

loans.use: to buy many metallic items (junked vehicles,...) to resell in Uganda

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Antonieta tiene 56 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de tejidos,ella teje chompas,mantas y pantalones y luego lo vende en forma independiente,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le gusta tejer mucho,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los tejidos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores y palitos de tejer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is requesting a loan to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.  She belongs to the Communal Bank, "Virgen del Carmen de Calca."  The bank is located in the Calca district, belonging to the province of Calca and Cusco.

Maria Antonieta is 56 years old and is involved in the textile business.  She knits sweaters, blankets and pants and then sells them independently.  She has been in this business for 5 years and enjoys knitting a lot.  Maria Antonieta's dream is to have a store where she can sell her knitting ware.  She is requesting a loan to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.

Maria Antonietar is happy for the loan and agrees to meet the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon is from Tajikistan. He is 23 years old and is not married yet. He lives with parents. To make a living, he sells food items as sugar, pasta, oil, conserves (a mixture of fruit, often with raisins and sometimes nuts, that is cooked until it becomes very thick and chunky), etc. in the shop. He has been engaged in his business for 3 years and earns little money for these activities. He wants to offer a wider variety of goods and in this way attract many customers. He is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy food items for more variety.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and buy an over machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The lead member of this group is a shy, traditional 24-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 3 years experience, and with a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, she is planning to buy an embroidery machine, a table and chair for her sewing machine, and some fabric and raw materials. Through these purchases and the investment she has made, she is hoping to improve her little business and offer better services for her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor (thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual). As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this group of borrowers has been altered for their  protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a table and chair for her sewing machine, and some fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
Guliston is 32 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a successful businesswoman. She is married and has two clever children. She graduated from the Pedagogical University. She is a teacher of biology but her salary from teaching is small and that’s why she began her own business selling cloth some years ago. 

As she is very smart, her business has developed year by year. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and in this way improve her living conditions. Her husband helps her with the business. 

Guliston wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan to buy new varieties of cloth to expand the assortment of her goods. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and over machine and buy an embroidery machine and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair the vehicle for her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, of Lower Tiparak, Oroquieta, helps her family by providing services such as cake baking for birthdays and other occasions. She’s a 46-year-old married mom with 1 child, who tries her best to earn on her own. For 11 years, she has managed this business. She earns about PHP 16,000 per month. For the time being, she’s needs to buy more equipment for her business. She joined this year and thank GDMPC microfinance for the loan of PHP 20,000 it provided to her. Gemma desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Elevenia

texts.en:
Elevenia is 38 years old and married with three children.

Elevenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Elevenia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and vegetables.

Elevenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 43 years old and married with six children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Alejandra has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr:
Jean Marie Vianney  est né au Rwanda et a 25 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1 ans. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants.  Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de secondaire.

Jean Marie Vianney  est commerçant. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter en gros du sucre, riz, sel, huile pour le revendre dans sa boutique……, payer le frais de transport.

Pour faire croitre son commerce il planifie de donner un service de qualité à ses clients et avoir des diversités des articles pour attire plus des clients et sollicite d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  devenir un grossiste des produits alimentaire. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de son enfant, construire une maison et assure le bien être de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney was born in Rwanda and is 25 years old. He is married and has one child, who is a year old. He has one person to support other than his child. He has two years of secondary education.

Jean Marie Vianney is a merchant. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy in bulk: sugar, rice, salt, oil… to resell in his store. and to pay the transport costs. 

To grow his business, he plans to provide quality service to his customers, have a diversity of goods in order to attract customers, and request more loans to increase his business. In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesale grocer. With the profits, he plans on covering the cost of his child's schooling, build a house, and ensure his future family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy in bulk some sugar, rice, salt, and oil to resell in his store.... and to pay for transport costs

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Jose Octavio tiene 72 años de edad,el socio tiene un negocio de ferreteria,el socio vende clavos,pinturas y herramientas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m.el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas,pinturas y clavos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; The bank is located in the province of Calca and in the department of Cusco. 

The bank member, Jose Octavio, is 72 years old. He has a hardware store, from which he sells nails, paint and tools. He works from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. He has had this business for 8 years. His dream is to make his business bigger. He has requested a loan to buy tools, paint, and nails. 

The bank member is happy to have the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools, paint and nails.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Luisa tiene 61 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales,ella vende en el mercado,la socia vende trigo,cebada y moraya,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia tiene 7 años en este negocio en sus ratos libres la socia le gusta preparar tortas para su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar trigo,cebada y moraya.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; the bank is located in the district of Calca in Calca province, Cusco Department. Luisa, 61, sells grains such as wheat and barley and dehydrated potatoes in the market from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. This has been her business for 7 years and the means by which she hopes to get ahead. In her free time, she likes to bake cakes for her family. She dreams of having a stand where she can sell grains and will use this loan to buy wheat, barley, and dehydrated potatoes. She is pleased to have the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley,and dehydrated potatoes.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a married man living with his wife and three children. Two of them are working and one is still attending school. He’s a 42-year-old hard worker looking to better enhance his family’s way of living. Zakariya has many years of experience in his current job. He’s a furniture painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized.
Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added painting tools for his business such as brushes, oils, new paint colors, and many other items. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his work and take on added projects. Zakariya is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take more projects maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase more painting tools for his business.

loans.name: Les Phares De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Terlius est le coordonateur de son groupe LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. Il est celibataire et  a 0 enfants. Il habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. 

Terlius a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Les Phares ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz, chaussures et des vetements. 

Terlius dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises. Terlius dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Terlius is the coordinator of his group LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. He is unmarried and has no children. He lives in the city of OUANAMINTHE in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Terlius has been running his business for the last six years. He would like to use this loan to invest in buying tennis shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to expand his business. The other members of Les Phares have need of a loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, rice, shoes, and clothing. 

Terlius says that his main challenge is a lack of regular customers. His dream is to buy a truck to transport merchandise. Terlius says his main goals include increasing his business.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre  est né au Rwanda et a 26 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.

Jean Paul  est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter en gros du sucre, riz, sel, huile pour le revendre dans sa boutique……, payer le frais de transport.

Pour faire croitre son commerce il planifie de donner un service de qualité à ses clients et avoir des diversités des articles pour attire plus des clients. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  devenir un grand, ouvrir d’autres alimentations et supermarché. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison et assure le bien être de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre was born in Rwanda and is 26 years old. He is not married. He has five years of secondary education.

Jean Pierre is a merchant. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy in bulk: sugar, rice, salt, and oil to resell in his store... and to pay the transport costs. 

To grow his business, he plans to provide quality service to his customers and have a diversity of goods in order to attract customers. In the coming years, he would like to become a major merchant and open other grocery stores and a supermarket. With the profits, he plans on building a house and ensuring his future family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy in bulk some sugar, rice, and oil to resell in his store and to pay for transport costs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marina se dedica al ngeocio de agricultura,ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y trigo y luego lo vende al por mayor estos productos,la socia tambien trabaja como profesora del nivel inicial en el distrito de Calca,la socia ya tiene 5 años dedicandose a la agricultura,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender sus productos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA.” The bank is located in the district of Calca in Calca province, department of Cusco. Marina owns agricultural land on which she grows corn and wheat to later sell at wholesale. She is also an elementary teacher in the Calca district. She has been farming for 5 years and dreams of having a stand where she can sell her products. Marina will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her framland. She is pleased to have this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Marie Rosine

texts.fr:
Mme Marie Rosine est une femme mariée, mère de 06 enfants âgés entre 30 et 14 ans. Elle s'active dans l'agriculture artisanale et le maraîchage.
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter des semences d'arachide pour cultiver et de pépinières de légumes et papate douce pour le maraîchage.
Avec le bénéfices de l'activité, elle va aider à la prise en charge de ses enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: Ms. Marie Rosine is a married woman and the mother of six children, from 14 to 30 years old. She is active in artisanal farming and market gardening. With this loan, she is going to buy peanut seeds to grow and some vegetable and sweet potato nurseries for her market gardening. With the profits from her business, she is going to help support his children and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy plant nurseries and seeds for her market gardening

loans.name: Martha Sinforosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Martha Sinforosa tiene 64 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de jora que es un productos que se usa para preparar chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia vende la jora en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de jora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar jora al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”. The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.  

The bank member, Martha Sinforosa, is 64 years old. She makes a living selling "jora" which is an ingredient that is used to prepare chicha, a fermented corn drink. She sells "jora" in the market from 8:00 am until 7:00pm. Her dream is to increase and improve her business. She has requested a loan to buy "jora" at wholesale cost.   

She is happy to receive a loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy "jora" (an ingredient used to make a traditional drink) at wholesale cost.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Avec ce troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, madame Yawa veut s’approvisionner en pagnes. Elle est âgée de 41ans, mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. C’est en 2004, qu’elle a  démarré l’activité et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérable lui permettant de se prendre en charge, d’assurer le niveau de vie de la famille. Elle veut créer une boutique, faire prospérer son activité et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: With this third loan she is requesting from our institution, Ms. Yawa wants to stock up on 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She is 41 years old and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. In 2004, she started her business and is very pleased with it because it brings in significant revenues enabling her to support herself and ensure her family's living situation. She wants to establish a store, make her business prosper, and see her children grow up under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth to sell
